column1: Facebook Inc (FB) TV App Is More Trouble Than You Think;February 01
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) opened for trade Feb. 1 at an all-time high - a market cap of $365 billion - on the strength of its dominance in mobile apps. But the big news is that Facebook is about to challenge the video league leaders with a mobile app for existing streaming boxes like theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) TV. The question is
column5: what will this do for FB stock?makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockMoving into TV through an app rather than a device makes sense
column6: given the failure of the original Facebook phone and its overwhelming success with apps for others' phones.FB is already bankrolling the creation of videos for the video tab of itsmobile app.So where does Facebook fit its service into the evolving market
column7: and what does its presence as a broadcaster mean to its claims not to be a media company?FB Stock: TV vs. PhoneThe company is already a presence in video thanks toFacebook Live
column8: which allows live streaming of video on the service and it has aPresidential endorsement.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatFB has prepared to offer longer videos by introducing ""mid-roll"" ads - ads that play in the middle of a video - to its line-up
column9: making the service more TV-like.Over time
column10: this might allow Facebook to compete directly withAmazon.com
column11: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column12: Netflix
column13: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) andAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column14: NASDAQ:GOOGL) YouTube in the growing market for streaming services.The problem is that there is a big difference between the experience you get on a mobile phone and what you want on a TV screen. A phone is active
column15: a TV is passive. A phone may support videos of a few minutes
column16: while people will watch TV for hours-and-hours.There is an assumption in the breathless reporting of Facebook's latest move that TV is easy; that it's just something you throw money at. Given the success of Netflix in generating subscribers and Emmys
column17: and Amazon in generating Prime members and Oscar buzz
column18: that is an easy mistake to make.Worth the Candle?For Facebook stock
column19: this may not be as huge a deal as analysts think.Netflix revenue is only a fraction of FB stock's. Analysts expect Facebook to deliver over $27 billion in 2016 revenue when it reports after the market closes Feb. 1. This is against roughly $9 billion for Netflix. NFLX also brings just 3% of that revenue to the bottom line
column20: while FB stock brings nearly one-third of revenue to its net income line.Entering the world of creating television poses another risk. CEO Mark Zuckerberg has repeatedly saidhe doesn't run a media company
column21: that his is just a communications service. Media companies have responsibilities to truth and accuracy that
column22: say
column23: phone companies don't have - responsibilitiesthat can limit profitability.If Facebook is going to license content from media suppliers
column24: whether live or scripted
column25: it becomes a media company
column26: subject to political and public scrutiny for its programming choices
column27: on a global basis. This is a dance FB stock shareholders should fear
column28: because it costs money to play
column29: and carries risk.Can Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Jump Over These Hurdles?But Facebook may now have no choice in the matter. The big screen is the last frontier for internet services
column30: it's where everyone is heading. FB stock does not want to be left behind.The Bottom Line on Facebook StockWhile most analysts are jumping for joy over the Facebook TV app news
column31: I am a lot more cautious. This move has enormous implications for the entire company
column32: for how it's perceived and (more important) what it costs to run.FB
column33: like Alphabet
column34: prefers to manage itself through algorithms. Algorithms scale in ways people do not. Facebook is starting to bow to pressure on the media front
column35: hiring Campbell Brownto coordinate media alliances. Now it's about to become a TV network
column36: or at least a streaming service.What will that mean to its profitability and growth? I think they both slow
column37: because people aren't algorithms and talent has temper that code does not have. Politics can kill the media star.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column38: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing he owned shares in AMZN
column39: GOOGL AAPL
column40: and FB.More From InvestorPlaceThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for February7 Awful Stocks You Need To Ditch Right AwayThe postFacebook Inc (FB) TV App Is More Trouble Than You Thinkappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Will the Apple Inc. HomeKit Beat Amazons Alexa? (AAPL);February 01
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) announced HomeKit - its strategy for becoming the center of the smart home - in June 2014.Amazon.com
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) revealed its Alexa-powered Echo smart speaker that November.makeArticleAd();Source: Apple/AmazonWhile there are currently several dozen HomeKit compatible smart home products
column6: Amazon's Alexa is now connected to thousands of smart products and services and has spread from the Echo to third-party devices.On the surface
column7: it looks as though Amazon has outmaneuvered and thoroughly trounced Apple. But despite the seemingly insurmountable lead and momentum
column8: AAPL could still end up beating AMZN in this smart home race.Here's how.Apple Chose the Closed Approach With HomeKitApple tends to be extremely cautious. Its software is designed to be user-friendly and secure. iPhone apps can't just be downloaded from anywhere; they need to go through the official App Store and that requires approval by AAPL. Third-party hardware needs to be certified by Apple before it can be marketed as being iOS-compatible.It's that ""walled"" approach that hasmade the iPhone more securethan smartphones runningAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL) Android operating system.With the iPhone and Siri - Apple's voice assistant - at the center of Apple's smart home strategy
column9: that focus on security
column10: compatibility and ease of use carried over toHomeKit. Manufacturers who want to make their smart devices HomeKit-compatible face a daunting series of requirements.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!As pointed out in a recent Reuters article ondiffering smart home approaches
column11: this includes being forced to buy a special HomeKit chip
column12: being limited to approved (and more expensive than average) Bluetooth and Wi-Fi chips and even extends to manufacturing being limited to factories that are certified by Apple. End-to-end encryption is mandatory. Once a HomeKit product is ready
column13: it faces extensive testing by Apple engineers to ensure compatibility.Thenit may be sold. That process alone can take three to five months.So you have additional costs
column14: the procedural red tape and a delay. It's easy to understand whyApple currently lists only 75 or so HomeKit-compatible devices. And half of those are either different color options or regional variations of the same product.Amazon Alexa Is Open for BusinessAmazon took a radically different approach with its Echo speaker and Alexa. The company openly courted third-party companies to develop Alexa ""skills"" or software-enabled interactions with an Amazon Alexa-powered device.A skill can be the ability to tell Alexa to order anUber. It could also be telling Alexa to turn on your home's smart lights or to start your electric car. The process is simple. Amazon provides an example showinghow to build an Alexa skill in 60 minutes
column15: and that includes the time needed to create a developer account. Submit the skill to AMZN for a quick verification
column16: and it's published.That's how Amazon Alexa tripled its available skills in just three months last year
column17: hitting 3
column18: 000 in September. If that sounds impressive
column19: by CES 2017 in January
column20: it had hit more than 7
column21: 000 Alexa skills.In addition to skills
column22: Amazon also encourages third parties to integrate Alexa functionality into their products. That way
column23: consumers get the Alexa experience without requiring an Echo speaker.That's a far easier process than Apple HomeKit certification. A ""Works with Alexa"" label takes about 10 days to obtain (it can even be issued by third party labs) and doesn't require special chips. According to the Reuters post
column24: that has resulted in over 250 products that are Alexa-certified. We saw some of these at CES
column25: including third-party speakers with Alexa and even home appliances with built-in Alexa capability.Smart Home Security: Apple Strength
column26: Amazon Alexa VulnerabilityThe differing approaches of AMZN and AAPL have led to Alexa rapidly leaping to a massive lead over HomeKit in the smart home. However
column27: there is one scenario where this could change rapidly.Security is increasingly becoming an issue for smart
column28: connected devices. Apple's HomeKit approach emphasizes security
column29: to the point of forcing the use of specialized chips and even certified manufacturing facilities.Amazon's Alexa strategy
column30: on the other hand
column31: leaves its platform relatively exposed. Amazon told Reuters it can't guarantee the security of third-party devices running Alexa. Those thousands of Alexa skills also integrate with third-party services that may have their own vulnerabilities.Trade of the Day: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock No Longer a Home RunAll it would take is one catastrophic hacking for a PR disaster that turns consumers off Alexa. As CNET puts it in a review of thehacking risks for different smart home standards: ""Don't assume that a device has high security standards just because it works with Alexa.""Bottom LineThere's no disputing the fact that Amazon completely caught Apple and others off guard with its stealthy approach of sneaking Alexa into the home using its Echo connected speaker.Before the Echo
column32: it was generally assumed that a smartphone would be the natural smart home controller. Making Alexa integration so open has also paid off for AMZN
column33: resulting in a formidable lead in the smart home in a very short time. That lead may well turn into complete domination of the connected home. But Amazon's open approach may also prove to be its Achilles heel.Should hackers turn their attention to Amazon Alexa
column34: the resulting headlines may flip the equation and put the much more secure Apple HomeKit on top in the long run.As of this writing
column35: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Pops Following Vindicating Q1 EarningsFriday Apple Rumors: Designer Creates Interesting iPhone 8 ConceptCan Apple Inc. (AAPL) Afford a War With Qualcomm
column36: Inc. (QCOM)?The postWill the Apple Inc. HomeKit Beat Amazon's Alexa? (AAPL)appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Nokia Corp (ADR) (NOK) Stock Is Still Hobbling;February 01
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK) is quintessentially Finnish - beautiful
column5: rugged
column6: quirky and a bit tragic. Once considered the preeminent mobile phone platform
column7: its reign was challenged briefly byBlackBerry Ltd(NASDAQ:BBRY)
column8: then permanently byApple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL). Today
column9: NOK stock is more than just a phone company
column10: but will Wall Street care?makeArticleAd();Source:Open Grid Scheduler / Grid Engine via Flickr (Modified)Its fourth quarter of fiscal year 2016 earnings report is set for release before the opening bell on Feb. 2.Would-be buyers and traders have a tough call to make. We all love stories of the great comeback
column11: and Nokia stock is a candidate. Shedding its legacy image as a boxy-cell-phone manufacturer
column12: NOK stock has been extremely acquisitive.We're not just talking about the buyout ofAlcatel-Lucent
column13: although that is a big part of the story. It's also the procurement of lesser known assets that will assert Nokia's new role as apublic networksprovider.At the same time
column14: we're talking about NOK stock here. Recently
column15: InvestorPlacecontributor Will Ashworth slammed Nokia stock as still being ""a dog with fleas
column16: borrowing a line from the iconic movieWall Street.It's a fitting description of a company which has ""delivered a scintillating annualtotal returnover the past 15 years of -7.14%
column17: more than 11 percentage points worse than theS&P 500.""7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018Whatever management has up their sleeves
column18: they better get to it. The markets are many things
column19: but patient usually isn't one of them.The Nitty Gritty of Nokia EarningsLet's take a deeper look at the Nokia earnings. The average consensus estimate for earnings per share is 8 cents - smack in the middle of the forecast spectrum. For the top line
column20: analysts are predicting sales to come in a range of $6.8 billion at the low to $7.6 billion at the high
column21: with a $7.2 billion consensus.To say that the Nokia earnings environment is challenged is putting it mildly. First off
column22: recent performances by NOK stock leave a lot to be desired. Fiscal 2016 is mostly a disappointment
column23: with two misses and a narrow beat.Unless Nokia is planning to pull the proverbial rabbit out of the hat
column24: I'm not sure what they can do. The financials for Nokia stock aren't exactly inspiring.Not surprisingly
column25: Zacks Equity Research prospects for Nokia earnings are dim. Their analysts rank NOK stock as a ""sell
column26: citing a litany of problems. Chief among them is the patent war that Nokia finds itself embroiled in with Apple. After losing the mobile phone business to Cupertino
column27: NOK has devolved into whatInvestorPlacecontributor Dana Blankenhorn calls a""patent troll.""That's all fun and games when you pester from your home turf. But Nokia seemed to forget the first rule of trolling: don't troll those that can beat the crap out of you. Mighty Apple has had enough
column28: and they're going to leverage their 22:1valuation disparityagainst Nokia.Again
column29: as Blankenhorn states
column30: that forces NOK stock into a weak hand.NOK Stock Is Wickedly UnpredictableClick to EnlargeStepping aside from the granularity of Nokia earnings
column31: trading the shares based on its financial reports has a dubious history. Since Q4 of fiscal 2013
column32: the average performance of Nokia stock quarter-to-quarter is a pretty sad -1.9%. Really
column33: you just have to pull up the chart from the fall of 2014. It's just like ""Stairway to Heaven
column34: only in the opposite direction.What that tells you is that if you do intend to trade Nokia earnings
column35: do so quickly and firmly. Trying to make up for losses usually results in an extension of those losses. And the markets do not make it easy. In the last three reports
column36: Nokia stock was positive heading towards the earnings release. On the day of
column37: NOK fell to an average of 6%.Can GoPro Inc (GPRO) Stock Escape Its Bearish Dogma?For those who want to try their hand at a little Wall Street Russian roulette
column38: a tip of the hat to you! For everybody else
column39: I would just stay away from NOK stock. There are deep-seated fundamental challenges with the company that have yet to be adequately addressed.Until that day comes
column40: Nokia stock remains a liability.As of this writing
column41: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryThe 5 Best Stocks to Buy for Big Emerging Markets ProfitsThe postNokia Corp (ADR) (NOK) Stock Is Still Hobblingappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: What Apple's (AAPL) Earnings Say About The Future;February 01
column3: 10:51:10 AM EDT;"When you regularly give your opinion on something as unpredictable as financial markets
column4: gloating when you get something right is rarely a good idea. That is especially true when those opinions arearchivedfor all to see; it's too easy for a reader to check out that archive and find examples of when the market and hindsight combine to make even logical arguments seem foolish. I am fully aware of that
column5: but when it comes to yesterdaysearnings release from Apple(AAPL)
column6: I will still say""told you!""What really matters about the Apple release to investors is certainly not that I got it right
column7: nor is it even that the tech giant returned to growth in revenue for the first time in a year
column8: nor that the already great margins at Apple increased. Those last two are important
column9: but necessarily backward looking
column10: as all hard data in an earnings release are by definition.What matters most is what the report tells us about the future and there the message was somewhat mixed.makeArticleAd();The official guidance for Q1 2017 contained in the release fell just short of Wall Streets expectations
column11: which would normally be enough of a negative to more than offset the good historical results. In this case
column12: though
column13: a look at where Apple succeeded in Q4 2016 suggests that that guidance may just be another example of Apples past tendency to err on the side of under-promising and over-delivering when it comes to guidance. That is why
column14: even though growth stalled last year
column15: AAPL has beaten EPS expectations in three of the last four quarters.First and foremost
column16: iPhone sales hit another record. That is particularly significant as not that long ago many were predicting that Google parent Alphabet (GOOG:GOOGL)s move into the phone business would do Apple some serious harm. It looks now as if those saying that were about as accurate as those that maintained that the Windows phone from Microsoft (MSFT) or the Amazon (AMZN) Fire phone would be the next big thing.The fact is that the iPhone has an iconic status that looks almost impossible to challenge. Even phones that are objectively better in some ways
column17: such as memory capacity
column18: camera resolution
column19: or speaker quality for example
column20: cannot take market share. As Apple advances the iPhone with each release
column21: beating them on those and other fronts becomes harder
column22: but remains
column23: according to the evidence so far
column24: a pointless exercise. As long as that dynamic remains
column25: holding Apple stock and adding to holdings at times of weakness still makes sense for investors.The weakness in this release was mainly in one area; iPad sales declined for the twelfth successive quarter. That
column26: however
column27: was offset to some extent by strong sales of Macs and Apple Watches. For the latter we are reliant on the word of Tim Cook as Apple doesnt release a breakdown of watch sales
column28: but
column29: as I pointed out in the article referenced above
column30: anybody who tried to buy a Series Two watch as a Christmas gift is probably aware that sales were at least more than Apple expected. None were available in any of the five states where I tried and most stores have just now received inventory.That shortage of watches
column31: combined with Cooks admission that they seriously underestimated demand for the iPhone 7 Plus
column32: means that the record sales reported yesterday were achieved with a background of supply constraints. Given that and the fact that there was considerable growth in areas such as services and enterprise operations that still have lots of room for Apple to expand
column33: the message underlying yesterdays earnings is that
column34: despite conventional wisdom
column35: growth can still be achieved."

column1: Apple, Inc. Earnings: Why the "Most Accurate" Apple Analyst Blew It;February 01
column4: Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) posted strong earnings results for the first   quarter of its 2017 fiscal year. Revenue beat analysts' forecasts   and the company's own guidance range. Earnings per share   comfortably beat the average analyst estimate as well. Finally
column5: iPhone sales rose 5% year over year
column6: to 78.3 million units; most   analysts had been expecting a smaller increase -- or even a   decline.Apple posted strong iPhone sales for the critical holiday     quarter. Image source: Apple.makeArticleAd();One of those analysts wrongly expecting an iPhone sales   decline was Ming-Chi Kuo of Taiwan's KGI Securities. In the past   few years
column7: Kuo has gained a reputation among many investors for   being the ""most accurate Apple analyst."" The fact that he whiffed so badly on his iPhone sales forecast   is an important reminder to investors not to rely too much on   analysts' forecasts.Understanding the ""most accurate"" Apple analystMing-Chi Kuo has very good sources -- either in Apple's supply   chain or at the company itself -- giving him advance warning of   new product features and production plans. He isn't perfect
column8: but   he's one of the best sources out there for news about Apple's   future products.Ming-Chi Kuo correctly predicted many features of the iPhone     7 and iPhone 7 Plus. Image source: Apple.For example
column9: Kuocorrectly predictedmost of the key features of the iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus prior   to those models being officially unveiled last September. That   included obscure details like the fact that there wouldn't be   32GB versions of the new jet black iPhones.Kuo also has a pretty good track record for short-term   shipment forecasts. A few days before Apple's Q1 earnings report   two years ago
column10: he predicted that Apple had sold 73 million   iPhones during the holiday quarter
column11: when most analysts still   expected a shipment number well below 70 million. In fact
column12: Apple   reported that it had shipped 74.5 million iPhones.However
column13: Kuo's competitive advantage appears to be limited to   picking up supply chain rumors. When it comes to estimating   demand for Apple's products
column14: his record is far less pristine.Underestimating iPhone sales by a mileFor the past several months
column15: Ming-Chi Kuo had stuck to a   forecast that Apple would ship 70 million-75 million iPhones in   the first quarter. At the midpoint of that range
column16: iPhone sales   would have been down 3% year over year
column17: whereas iPhone sales   actuallyincreased5%.This doesn't fully capture how far off Kuo's expectations   were
column18: though. Prior to late September
column19: he had expected Apple to   ship just 65 million iPhones in Q1
column20: down 13% year over year.The further you zoom out
column21: the worse Kuo's predictions have   been. Back in April
column22: he stated that in a best-case scenario
column23: Apple would ship 205 million iPhones for the full 2016 calendar   year. (His worst-case scenario was 190 million shipments.) Apple   actually shipped 215.4 million iPhones for the full year.Don't trust analysts too muchInvestors who soldApple stocklast year -- or decided not to buy it -- based on Kuo's   relatively bearish projections have missed out on a big rally.   Since bottoming out around $90 last May
column24: Apple stock has come   roaring back
column25: reaching $125 in after-hours trading on Tuesday   afternoon. This shows the danger of relying too much on analysts'   forecasts.Apple Stock Performance
column26: data byYCharts.Following top analysts for a stock you own is a good way to   stay up to date on the latest trends and the general outlook for   the next few quarters. However
column27: while Wall Street analysts may in   theory be the ""experts
column28: even the best ones can make some big   mistakes. For individual investors
column29: it's important to understand   when to trust an analyst's predictions.For Apple
column30: Ming-Chi Kuo is an important analyst to follow for   learning about potential new products and early production plans
column31: because of his supply chain connections. However
column32: Apple's sales   results ultimately depend on demand.Being plugged in to the supply chain doesn't help much in   forecasting demand. Perhaps Kuo can accurately estimate how many   components Apple's suppliers are building. That shows how many   devices Apple plans to build -- and
column33: by extension
column34: how much   demand Apple expects to see. But build plans are fluid and   routinely change based on actual demand.Thus
column35: while Kuo is great at calling the play-by-play of what   Apple is doing now
column36: his analysis is less reliable looking further   into the future. Investors who have followed his advice over the   past several quarters just learned that lesson the hard way.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Amgen
column4: 10:13:02 AM EDT;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column5: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAs it's customary withAmgen
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMGN)
column7: the biotech giant topped analysts' expectation in each of the first three quarters of 2016. Chances are that it'll top expectations once more when it reports its fourth-quarter and full-year 2016 figures on Feb. 2. So if you're following AMGN stock
column8: you don't need to worry about Amgen's profits.makeArticleAd();Source:Richard Masoner via FlickrInstead
column9: you'll want to watch the following items Thursday when Amgen reports its fourth-quarter results:#1: Enbrel Sales TrendCompared to the third quarter of 2015
column10: Amgen reported flat product sales in Q3 2016. This was mostly due to its top-selling drug
column11: Enbrel
column12: losing ground. Sales for the drug had increased 24% in Q1 and 10% in Q2
column13: but in the third quarter
column14: total Enbrel sales were $1.452 billion
column15: versus $1.459 billion in the year-ago period.The problem doesn't seem to be seasonal fluctuation
column16: considering that Enbrel sales grew by 30% in Q3 2015
column17: compared to Q3 2014.7 Awful Stocks You Need To Ditch Right AwayThe problem is that competition is catching up. Amgen usually says
column18: ""offset partially by the impact of competition"" when giving details about Enbrel sales. However
column20: ""partially"" was conspicuously absent. Did someone just forget to copy-and-paste? Maybe. Maybe not.AMGN stock holders should pay attention to see if Enbrel will resume growth through increased volume
column21: as opposed to price hike.Enbrel faces three major growth barriers.First
column22: it competes againstAbbVie Inc's(NYSE:ABBV) Humira and Johnson & Johnson's Remicade. This leads to the second challenge.Stiff competition necessitates incremental rebates to payers to maintain its formulary position.The third challenge is the biosimilar availability. For instance
column23: the FDA has approved Erelzi
column24: an Enbrel biosimilar byNovartis AG (ADR)(NYSE:NVS).Put simply
column25: further lackluster Enbrel growth would weigh on AMGN stock.#2: Amgen's Drug PricingInvestors also should look closely at how fast Amgen is hiking prices.I raised concerns about Amgen stockgrowing sales by increasing drug prices
column26: instead of higher volumes
column27: after the company reported its Q2 2015 earnings. Almost two years on
column28: the trend of growing sales with price hikes is still commonplace at AMGN.From a business perspective
column29: it's smart to try to squeeze out every possible dollar from your inventions. However
column30: the U.S. government is standing up against it. President Donald Trump told drugmakers in aJan. 31 meetingthat ""we have to get the prices down.""This won't be good for the top and bottom lines of any drugmaker. However
column31: for a company who thrives on hiking drug prices like AMGN
column32: the downside gets bigger.#3: How Did Repatha Perform?Repatha is heralded as potentially one of Amgen's best sellers. The company said the drug caters to ""serious diseases with significant unmet needs."" However
column33: it brought in a meager $40 million in Q3.One barrier to market growth is that payers have employed utilization-management procedures
column34: which limited patients' ability to gain access to Repatha. Execs said during Q3 earnings call that they're working with payers and providers to allow unlabeled patient access. Investors should look to see if collaborations with payers and providers are yielding significant Repatha growth.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL): The Cheapest $800 Stock I KnowThe drug
column35: which currently competes withSanofiSA (ADR)(NYSE:SNY) andRegeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc's(NASDAQ:REGN) Praluent
column36: had a 55% share of new-to-brand prescriptions (NBRx) in Q4
column37: according to an Amgen presentation at this year's JPMorgan Healthcare Conference. Still
column38: AMGN stock holders probably want to know just how much in sales that amounted to.But it has to be noted that an ongoing court case that Amgen filed against Sanofi and Regeneron onpatent infringementgrounds is tipping the scale in Rapatha's favor for now.Finally
column39: investors should pay attention to see if low expenses is continuing and will continue at Amgen. Since the beginning of 2015
column40: AMGN has reduced its total expenses by roughly 3.7% to 13.22%. Keeping expenses low will be critical to future profitability
column41: especially in Trump's recent focus on drugmakers.Earnings apart
column42: I believe the uncertainties surrounding the future make AMGN stock less attractive.As of this writing
column43: Craig Adeyanju did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Pops Following Vindicating Q1 Earnings5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in February10 Stocks That Will Hurt Your Retirement

column1: Apple
column4: 10:00:00 AM EDT;"Image source: Apple.It's been a while sinceApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) posted a bona fide blowout quarter
column5: but I think   it's safe to say that last quarter qualifies.makeArticleAd();The Mac maker set an all-time record high with quarterly   revenue
column6: which came in at $78.4 billion. That's a few billion   higher than the $75.9 billion in sales that Apple generated a   year ago
column7: and above the high end of Apple's own guidance ($78   billion). Naturally
column8: that was driven by strong iPhone sales
column9: another record at 78.3 million. This all comes as the iPhone 7   was arguably the most incremental model update in years
column10: keeping   the same overall industrial design with no clear must-have   feature. Combined with the perennial supply constraints
column11: it's   rather impressive that the company was able to move that many   smartphones.Other quarterly records set in Q4 were earnings per share   ($3.36)
column12: services revenue ($7.2 billion)
column13: Mac revenue ($7.2   billion)
column14: Apple Watch units (who knows?!)
column15: and Apple Watch   revenue (your guess is as good as mine). Four out of Apple's five   geographical operating segments also set fresh highs (all but   Greater China). That's what I call comprehensive performance.Two cameras are better than oneAs usual
column16: the iPhone was the star of the show
column17: comprising   nearly 70% of sales. While sales were up 5%
column18: sell-through was up   8% thanks to robust demand. In line with CFO Luca Maestri'sprediction in October
column19: average selling prices (ASPs) bounced back sequentially with a   vengeance. ASPs were depressed for a few quarters in 2016   following the launch of the $400 iPhone SE
column20: but have now   rebounded to $695 -- pretty comparable to last year's $691.Data source: SEC filings. Chart by author. Calendar quarters     shown.This tells investors a few things
column21: some obvious and others   less so. Clearly
column22: the iPhone 7 Plus is a hit
column23: likely due to the   dual-camera system that is the most notable differentiating   feature. On the earnings call
column24: CEO Tim Cook noted that the mix   was skewed toward the Plus models more than in any prior cycle   (this is the third year that Apple has had Plus models with   5.5-inch displays). Cook even acknowledged later in the call that   Apple did not predict iPhone 7 Plus demand very well
column25: which   adversely affected production plans.Additionally
column26: Apple finally increased the entry-level storage   to 32 GB in 2016
column27: at long last addressing an increasingly   prominent customer complaint. The financial risk to that move was   removing the upsell incentive
column28: and the $100 to $200 that goes   with it. If 32 GB of storage is sufficient
column29: a larger proportion   of customers may opt for the base model instead of upgrading; 16   GB has long been woefully insufficient
column30: virtually assuring strong   upgrade activity. The good news is that Apple has maintained a   relatively comparable mix of upgrades
column31: as evidenced by the strong   ASP.Macs and iPadsThe fact that Mac revenue hit a new all-time high shows that   Apple still has tricks up its sleeve. We're talking about a   business that's over 40 years old
column32: after all. The new MacBook   Pros with Touch Bar were significantly constrained during the   quarter
column33: but the related price increase appears to have been able   to help Mac ASPs by quite a bit. Mac ASPs jumped sequentially   from $1
column35: 348; this is the first time in nearly three   years that this figure was above $1
column36: 300.There wasn't a whole lot of news on the iPad front
column37: in part   because Apple didn't update its tablet lineup in the fall. Apple   sold 13.1 million units
column38: down 19% from a year ago. iPad revenue   fell more than that due to declining ASPs ($423). The more   affordable iPads continue to prove rather popular. Cook said the   company has some exciting things in the pipeline for iPad
column39: potentially referring to the rumors around other display sizes or   the Apple Pencil 2.Services to $50 billionApple's services business has just officially become a $25   billion business on a trailing-12-month basis. Management   ambitiously hopes todoublethis business within the next four years
column40: targeting $50 billion   in annual revenue in 2020. That's an aggressive goal
column41: but also in   line with the company's efforts to shift investor attention   toward recurring revenue sources.CFO Luca Maestri noted that the App Store continues to be the   main driver of growth
column42: thanks to increased buying activity within   the installed based as well as new users coming to the platform.   The music business
column43: including both downloads and streaming
column44: has   started growing again over the past three quarters. iCloud   storage upsells are also growing ""very quickly
column45: as is AppleCare.   Simply put
column46: the plethora of services that Apple offers are all   faring well.Wrapping upShare repurchases came in at $11 billion
column47: which included $5   billion in open market purchases and a $6 billion accelerated   share repurchase (ASR) program. That's the ninth ASR for those   keeping score at home. The company retired 65.3 million shares   during the quarter thanks to these aggressive repurchases
column48: which   contributed to the record EPS due to its accretive effects.That puts cumulative share repurchases at $143.7 billion out   of the current $175 billion authorization. Apple updates its   capital return program every spring
column49: typically alongside its   April earnings release. There's plenty of room to accommodate   Apple's typical level of repurchases
column50: and investors can look   forward to an update next quarter.In terms of fundamentals
column51: the results were a blowout. Investor   reaction
column52: on the other hand
column53: is another topic. Shares jumped over   4% in extended trading
column54: and Apple hasn't traded around $125 since   mid-2015. I still have doubts about Apple enjoying any semblance   of multiple expansion
column55: but the business is as strong as ever.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column5: February 1
column6: 2017makeArticleAd();Payroll processing giant ADPADPhas released its January private sector jobs report before the bell this morning
column7: posting a far-better-than-expected 246K new jobs for the month. Consensus expectations had been for 164K. December's total was revised downward by 2000 jobs to 151K
column8: which is the range in which the U.S. labor market had been settling prior to this morning's number.The Services group still rules the roost
column9: with 201K new January jobs in the private sector
column10: whereas Goods brought in 46K. Manufacturing and Mining totals
column11: while not incredibly strong
column12: at least have swung to the positive - 15K and 6K
column13: respectively. Healthcare put up a strong 49K
column14: but the top two sectors were in Professional/Business Services at 71K and Trade/Transportation/Utilities at 63K.Good weather in January can likely take some of this credit. Medium-sized companies (between 50-499 employees) brought in the lion's share with 102K
column15: followed by large companies (500+ employees) at 83K
column16: with Small firms (under 50) picking up the remaining 62K. For years
column17: at least seemingly
column18: it had been small-business hiring which had kept the labor market strong. This looks to be shifting.The ADP report serves as somewhat of a forward indicator toward the monthly non-farm payroll results from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS)
column19: which also includes Government jobs and will be released Friday. However
column20: the analyst consensus for the BLS total is 174K as of now
column21: down considerably from today's private-sector results. Historically
column22: the ADP and BLS numbers don't always gibe in the near-term
column23: but upon revisions in future months they tend to track each other pretty consistently.What some economists predict going forward
column24: though
column25: is a labor market that shows increasing difficulties with filling open job positions. This is part of what it means to have an Unemployment rate at around 4.7%. This results in wage growth picking up
column26: which we've also seen some evidence of lately. So the potential problems with finding employees with the skill-sets to fill certain positions - which may be exacerbated by the Trump administration's rather draconian policies regarding immigration reform
column27: in that immigrants traditionally absorb many jobs on the lower levels of the pay-scale - may manifest in a stagnating labor market going forward.Earnings UpdateAppleAAPLput up Q1 2017 earnings numbers after the bell that were reminiscent of the tech giant's late-era Steve Jobs years
column28: blowing the doors off expectations for iPhone sales in the quarter. After the market closes this afternoon we will see results from social media leader FacebookFB. For a more in-depth analysis

column1: Apple Just Showed the Mac Is Back - What Does It Mean For PCs?;February 01
column3: 09:42:00 AM EDT;"Apple's (AAPL) fiscal first-quarter results came in better-than-expected
column4: thanks in part to strong iPhone sales. However
column5: it's the noticeable growth in the Mac unit that has caught investors' eyes.During the period
column6: Applesold5.374 million Macs
column7: generating $7.244 billion in revenue. Thats a 1% year over year increase in units and more importantly
column8: a 7% increase in revenue. It shows that despite all the media criticism about the new MacBook Pro with the TouchBar
column9: Apples products are resonating with the market.Drexel Hamilton analyst Brian White said the Mac sales came in well above his 4.74 million unit projection.makeArticleAd();The results helped Apple return to growth
column10: something that's been nipping at the heels of Apple and its investors for some time.Couple this fact
column11: along withstrong fourth-quarter resultsfrom Intel and its Client Computing unit and it looks like PC sales
column12: which have been in decline for so long
column13: are finally returning to some semblance of normalcy.Intel
column14: which reported earnings last week
column15: saw strength from its next-generation Kaby Lake CPUs. Credit Suisse analysts
column16: led by John Pitzer noted
column17: ""[Original design manufacturers] attributed better than expected builds to the introduction of INTC's next-gen Kaby Lake CPUs
column18: VR-ready NBs and MacBooks
column19: and stronger than expected demand at US [original equipment manufacturers].""Research firm Gartner noted fourth-quarter PC shipments totaled 72.6 million
column20: down 3.7% year-over-year. However
column21: Apple's continued push into the enterprise helped it
column22: as there was a refresh in the business community
column23: in addition to strength in the gaming market.For years
column24: the PC market has been in a sharp decline and while Gartner's figures show an industry still in decline
column25: the decline is moderating. With Apple's essentially flat unit growth
column26: that means it's taking market share
column27: as well as profit share
column28: something that bodes well for Apple and its shareholders.Click to see original TweetThe broader PC market is likely never return to the growth of the 1990's
column29: thanks in part to mobile devices. And while strong
column30: the influx of subsets like gaming PCs are too small to boost the overall market.However
column31: with Apple's latest innovations to its Mac lineup (and more tocome
column32: per CEO Tim Cook) and the rise of niche PC markets
column33: the sector is no longer an albatross area for investors."

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL): The Cheapest $800 Stock I Know;February 01
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsDisruption is everywhere.Amazon.com
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) disrupts how we shop
column6: whileAirbnbdisrupts where we stay.Tesla Motors Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) disrupts what we drive
column7: andUbereven disruptswhetherwe drive. If a teen with 2 million Instagram followers can disrupt how billion-dollar businesses find customers
column8: the rest of us need to dive in and start swimming  or at least buy the one stock which has its hands in all of the above:Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL).makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockSimply put
column9: GOOGL stock is the most innovative
column10: most disruptive and cheapest $800 equity I know.Let me explain.Silicon Valley money manager Michael Moe and his team at GSV Asset Management produce a provocative weekly newsletter dedicated to highlighting where they think the world is going. While doing research for myBullseye Brief
column11: one of their recent pieces got me thinking about innovation in more tangible terms. The team ranked eight global technology companies based on their involvement across 22 cutting-edge categories. Hands down
column12: Alphabet ranks No. 1
column13: capturing 21 of 22.Innovation LeadersCuriously
column14: all eight GSV-highlighted companies have dedicated efforts in the areas of artificial intelligence
column15: big data and cloud services
column16: making these three the Holy Grail of innovation.The first two come as no surprise
column17: as data gathering and analysis are critical to predicting behavior
column18: enabling companies to target consumers accordingly. Web services
column19: which is now the fastest-growing segment for Amazon
column20: is less obvious but nonetheless a clear indicator these innovators want to get bigger by serving as the backbone for other companies.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatThis is key
column21: and since Google already commands 49% of the global online advertising market according to Pivotal Research analyst Brian Wieser
column22: I'll bet on GOOGL.MoonshotMuch of Google's innovative efforts happen at its off-site research center called Google X
column23: aka the Moonshot Factory. It's run by a futurist named Astro Teller
column24: and I highly recommend hisTED Talkexplaining how Google X approaches innovation:Identify a problem affecting millions of people.Find or propose a radical solution for solving that problem.Move full speed ahead if there's reason to believe technology for such a radical solution could actually be built.He says Google X people spend most of their time ""breaking things and trying to prove they're wrong"" but believes that's their secret  what makes Googlers different. By ""killing"" more projects than they approve
column25: their success rate rises. Alphabet spent $13.8 billion last year on research and development - the second highest number of any company in the world behind Amazon
column26: and second highest as a percentage of sales among the eight innovation leaders.R&D as % of RevenueAlphabet invests a staggering amount of money to fund R&D
column27: both because it can and because it has to. With three times more online advertising than its next closest competitor
column28: GOOGL is a cash cow.By the same token
column29: it has significant overlap with all seven competitors in the most obvious categories - like robotics and AI- and each of these companies is hungry to dominate.There's no letting up in this crowd. Innovate or die.What's GOOGL Stock Worth?Ultimately
column30: the question is value: What do we pay?I like to compare the growth we're getting (earnings) with the price we're paying (price-to-earnings
column31: or P/E). This is called a price/earnings-to-growth ratio (PEG)
column32: and it's an intuitive way to compare apples to apples.Using 2017 consensus estimates tracked by Bloomberg
column33: GOOGL stock is tucked right in the middle of the pack. Its PEG ratio is 1.08. PEGs below 1 are cheap
column34: and PEGs approaching 2 are expensive.PEG ratios are revealing.First of all
column35: no one should buyMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT). It's neither a growth stock nor a value play.Alibaba Group Holding Ltd(NYSE:BABA) is a tad expensive
column36: but not excessively so
column37: especially since many consider ittheChinese consumer trading vehicle.Amazon is attractive
column38: so areApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)
column39: both of which I have written up as longs and currently own.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!Samsung(OTCMKTS:SSNLF)
column40: I admit is a mystery. It'ssocheap. I can only surmise its limited German and S. Korean listings deter U.S. investors
column41: as does the $1
column42: 700 stock price. It needs to split at least 10-to-1.The TradeSell the GOOGL April $800 puts at $20 to initiate a long-biased position.If the stock pulls back and trades through the $800 strike price
column43: I'm assigned shares and become a buyer. If Google continues making new highs
column44: I pocket the premium. I am content either way. Google's chart indicates initial technical support around $780
column45: and significant long-term support $700-$725.The reason I'm selling puts rather than buying the stock is because GOOGL stock has recently risen to a new all-time high. I know new highs tend to beget new highs (momentum traders buy strength)
column46: but I'm a value buyer at heart.Adam Johnson is Founder and Author ofBullseye Brief
column47: an investment newsletter that presents thematic and actionable ideas. As of this writing
column48: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities. Follow him on Twitter at@AJInsight.More From InvestorPlaceAdvanced Micro Devices

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!;February 01
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) reported its fiscal first-quarter earnings on Tuesday after the bell
column5: and it kicked the year off the right way. Apple set an all-time quarterly revenue record - snapping its streak of declines - and broke its previous iPhone sales record. AAPL stock is up strongly Wednesday morning as a result.makeAd('4'
column7: 'mktsnews'
column8: 'vanguard'
column10: '');Source: AppleBut the star of yesterday's show wasn't the iPhone. It was the Services division
column11: which includes the App Store
column12: Apple Pay
column13: iTunes
column14: AppleCare and Apple Music. Services didn't just set another record - it also posted the strongest year-over-year growth of any AAPL division.Services Is on Fire
column15: Led by the App StoreApple reported that the quarterly revenue for its Services division topped $7.17 billion for Q1
column16: an increase of 18% compared to the previous year. If that sounds like a lot of money for what is largely made up of mobile payment transaction fees and digital content
column17: it is. In comparison
column18: Netflix
column19: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) experienced its largest-ever subscriber growth in the final quarter of 2016
column20: leading it to post revenue of $2.48 billion.During the AAPL earnings conference call
column21: CEO Tim Cook noted that he expects the Services division to bethe size of a Fortune 100 company by the end of the year. Other key information about the Services division from that earnings call includes:App Store revenue for December alone was a record-setting $3 billionThere are now 2.2 million apps in the App Store
column22: and AAPL paid out over $20 billion to developers in 2016The number of Apple Pay users has tripled over the past year
column23: with transaction volume up over 500% year-over-yearAppleCare and storage services (iCloud) both set all-time recordsApple's music business grew for the third straight quarterWhy Services Revenue is ImportantYou might not know it based on Apple's record-setting iPhone sales this quarter
column24: but selling hardware is tough.The Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryOnce a consumer has an iPhone in his or her hands
column25: it becomes very difficult to convince them to spend a minimum $649 to ditch that smartphone for a new one. In one sense
column26: a huge installed user base - which AAPL has
column27: withmore than 1 billion iOS devices in active use- works against the company. When the iPhone first began to take off
column28: AAPL was selling to people who'd never owned one before. Now
column29: that pool of easy sales is dwindling. And Apple is left in the tougher position of convincing its installed user base to upgrade.Thus the hand-wringing about slowing iPhone sales.Apple's Services division largely benefits from that huge installed user base
column30: though. True
column31: AAPL only gets one shot at selling these customers AppleCare. But once they own an iPhone
column32: iPad
column33: iPod
column34: Mac
column35: Apple Watch or AppleTV
column36: they begin to explore Apple's other services. They are increasingly adopting Apple Pay. They are in a prime position to buy movies on their Apple TV. They are perfect candidates to subscribe to Apple Music. There are plenty of hooks for storing data on iCloud. And of course
column37: there is the App Store and the lure of its millions of apps.Apple's Services revenue doesn't come in big chunks like selling an iPhone. It's $9.99 a month here
column38: 99 cents for an app there
column39: a few cents for a transaction. But it adds up
column40: especially when over a billion customers are generating it.More importantly
column41: that revenue doesn't drop off the same way hardware revenue does when people stop buying new iPhones.Some services - like iCloud and Apple Music - are subscription-based. AAPL keeps automatically billing the customer's card every month regardless of whether their iPhone is brand new or five years old. Apple Pay revenues are increasing as more countries and businesses accept it and iPhone owners grow more accustomed to using it.Bottom Line for AAPLPeople never stop buying apps. They may slow down after the initial rush of a new device
column42: but developers keep bring enticing new games and other apps to the App Store. That means the 1 billion users continue to download.Trade of the Day: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock No Longer a Home RunJust look at the 40 million-plusSuper Mario Rundownloads from the App Storein only four days.How many iPhones will AAPL sell two years from now? No one knows for sure
column43: but odds are it won't be many more than it does now. On the other hand
column44: Apple is confident its highflying App Store
column45: Apple Pay and other services will see Services division revenue double in that time.The iPhone may have driven Apple stock growth over the past decade. But Services revenue is increasingly important as AAPL stock searches for that elusive next hardware hit.As of this writing
column46: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatCan Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Jump Over These Hurdles?The Only 3 Vanguard Funds You Need to Build a PortfolioThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Inc.'s Record Quarter Returns the Company to Growth;February 01
column4: 08:43:00 AM EDT;"After market on closed on Tuesday
column5: tech giantApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) put to rest any doubts about the company's ability   to post strong holiday results. Shares moved a few percentage   points higher immediately after the company released its figures   for its Dec. 31-ending first fiscal quarter of 2017. Apple's   revenue and earnings exceeded both management's own forecast for   the quarter and analysts' consensus estimate.Image source: Apple.makeArticleAd();Here's a look at some of the biggest takeaways from the   results.Financial resultsMetricQ1 2017Q1 2016Year-Over-Year ChangeRevenue$78.4 billion$75.9 billion3.3%Earnings per share$3.36$3.282.4%Gross profit margin38.5%$40.1%(160 basis points)Data source: AppleQ1 2017 press release. Table by author.Apple's revenue reached an all-time high of $78.4 billion
column6: up   3.3% from the year-ago quarter and above the company's guidance   for $76 billion to $78 billion. In addition
column7: Apple's EPS of $3.28   easily exceeded the midpoint of its guidance range for about   $3.17.Segment resultsThe iPhone remained crucial to Apple's overall results
column8: accounting for nearly 70% of total revenue during the quarter.   With a 5% year-over-year increase in iPhone revenue
column9: the product   segment played a key role in Apple's better-than-expected   financial results.But the tech giant's services segment
column10: which accounts for   sales from the App Store
column11: iTunes
column12: Apple Music
column13: iCloud
column14: Apple Pay
column15: licensing
column16: and other services
column17: was also important. Services   revenue was up 18% year over year
column18: accounting for 9.1% of the   quarter's total results -- up from 8% in the year-ago quarter.   Apple CEO Tim Cook commented specifically on Apple's services   segment performance
column19: saying the growth was ""led by customer   activity on the App Store.""Data source: Apple Q1 2017 press release. Chart by     author.Another bright spot from Apple's segment results was Mac. With   the help of its new MacBook Pro
column20: the segment's revenue increased   7% year over year.However
column21: not all of Apple's product segments were on the rise   during the quarter. Apple's iPad revenue continued its downward   trend
column22: with revenue falling 22% year over year. Other products   revenue
column23: which includes sales of Apple TV
column24: Apple Watch
column25: Beats   products
column26: iPod
column27: and accessories
column28: saw its revenue decline 8% year   over year. But Apple was careful to note in its first-quarter   press release that despite the decline in other products revenue
column29: Apple Watch revenue hit an all-time high.GuidanceApple also notably said it expects revenue growth to continue   in the company's second quarter -- an important guide
column30: considering the company reported three straight quarters of   year-over-year revenue declines in fiscal 2016. Apple guided for   second-quarter revenue to be in the range of $51.5 billion to   $53.5 billion
column31: up from $50.6 billion in the year-ago quarter.Looking beyond the financial results for Apple's second   quarter
column32: Cook said the Apple team is ""excited"" about the products   in its pipeline.The strong quarter for the tech giant
column33: along with a nice   return to growth for the current quarter and for expected revenue   in Q2
column34: reinforces the company's ability to drive results for   shareholders even in a post hyper-iPhone-growth era.Cook was pleased with the company's performance: ""Our team   executed extremely well in the face of strong macroeconomic   headwinds. We are very happy with the continued strong growth in   revenue from services

column1: iShares Nasdaq Biotechnology Index (ETF) (IBB) Shows Signs of Hope;February 01
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsBiotechnology stocks - as represented by theiShares Nasdaq Biotechnology Index (ETF)(NASDAQ:IBB) - rallied about 2.8% on Tuesday. As a result
column5: the IBB ETF left behind on the daily chart what technical analysts refer to as a bullish outside reversal day.makeArticleAd();The rally came on the back of a meeting with President Donald Trump and several large pharmaceutical CEOs at the White House on Tuesday. While more clarity is needed as to what the Trump administration's exact agenda is for the pharmaceutical space - which includes the world of biotechnology - for the moment
column6: Tuesday's price action in these stocks must be respected.Throughout the presidential campaign
column7: the pharmaceutical sector was an area of focus by the candidates. Stocks within this sector saw plenty of gyrations as a result. While the broader stock market and many sectors pushed to new highs following the election results last November
column8: pharma and biotech stocks largely speaking to this day remain range-bound and have shown relative weakness.IBB ETF ChartsThe best way to illustrate this is by the following ratio chart where I divided the IBB ETF by theS&P 500- as represented by the popularSPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust(NYSEARCA:SPY). Note the clear relative weakness that biotech stocks have shown versus the broader stock market.While the fund showed some relative strength on Tuesday
column9: the series of lower highs thus far remains well intact.Click to EnlargeOn the multiyear weekly chart
column10: we see the choppy sideways range that biotechnology stocks have been in since early 2016.The Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryFrom this angle - and through the lens of directional longer-term investors - this range should be respected. Because until it resolves in one direction or another

column12: and it's difficult to see this on the multiyear chart
column13: but last week and this week (so far)
column14: the IBB is marking the charts with long bullish candles. Intraweek selloffs so far are getting bought. This may be an initial bullish signal worth paying attention to.The area around $265-$270 on the IBB is getting increasingly important as support.On the daily chart
column15: we see that the IBB etf has narrowed its trading range since last fall by making a series of higher lows and lower highs. Of note
column16: however
column17: is the breakaway gap to the upside from last November following the presidential election results.Click to EnlargeWhile the IBB is still trotting sideways
column18: the lower end of the post-election up-gap continues to hold as support.Lastly
column19: let's note the bullish price action from yesterday
column20: Jan. 31. The IBB ETF initially traded lower before quickly snapping higher and closing near the very highs of the day. The daily candle fully engulfed the previous 10 days' worth of price action.Trade of the Day: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock No Longer a Home RunActive investors could try to play some follow-through buying in the fund. If and when this takes hold

column4: 07:30:00 AM EDT;"makeZacksArticleAd();Shares ofApple Inc.AAPLwere up over 3% in aftermarket trading following better-than-expected first quarter of fiscal 2017 results.Earnings of $3.36 per share and revenues of $78.4 billion easily topped the respective Zacks Consensus Estimate of $3.22 and $76.9 billion. On a year-over-year basis
column5: both metrics registered growth of 2.4% and 3.3%.Product DetailsThe good show was driven by impressive sales of Apple's latest smartphone model iPhone 7 and 7 Plus. Performance of Apple's Services business was also impressive.Total iPhone unit sales came in at about 78.3 million
column6: up 5% year over year. Revenues from iPhone also grew 5% from the year-ago quarter to $54.4 billion (69.4% of total revenue).Services
column7: which include revenues from Internet Services
column8: App store
column9: Apple Music
column10: AppleCare
column11: Apple Pay
column12: licensing and other services
column13: surged 18% year over year (with extra one week in the quarter) to nearly $7.2 billion. App Store sales in December alone topped $3 billion. Apple said that it expects Services ""revenues to be the size of a Fortune 100 company this year.""Apple Inc. Price

column15: Consensus and EPS Surprise|Apple Inc. QuoteManagement also noted that Apple Pay reported transaction volume growth of 500%
column16: buoyed by expansion to markets like Spain
column17: Japan
column18: Russia and New Zealand. At present Apple Pay is available in 13 markets.Apple Mac unit sales were up 1% year over year to approximately 5.4 million
column19: while revenues grew 7% from the prior-year quarter to $7.2 billion.Coming to iPad
column20: Apple sold 13.1 million units in the quarter
column21: down 19% year over year. Revenues of $5.5 billion were down 22% from the prior year quarter.Other products
column22: which include revenues from Apple TV
column23: Apple Watch
column24: Beats products
column25: iPod and Apple-branded and third-party accessories
column26: declined 8% year over year to over $4 billion. Again
column27: there were no data available on Apple Watch sales or its latest product launch
column28: AirPods.Geographical PerformanceDemand for Apple's products improved across most of the geographical regions except greater China. As much as 64% of sales were from the International markets.Americas (the biggest market for Apple) generated revenues of approximately $32 billion in the quarter
column29: up 9% year over year.Europe generated nearly $18.5 billion in revenues
column30: up 3% on a year-over-year basis.Revenues from Japan rose 20% year over year to $5.8 billion while the rest of Asia Pacific generated revenues of $5.8 billion
column31: up 8% year over year.Owing to persistent macroeconomic weakness
column32: Apple revenues declined around 12% year over year in the Greater China region to $16.2 billion.MarginsGross margin was 38.5%
column33: a decline of 160 basis points (bps) from the year-ago quarter.Operating expenses increased 9% year over year to $6.8 billion due to higher research & development expenses as well as selling
column34: general and administrative expenses. As a result
column35: operating margin plunged 210 bps from the year-ago quarter to 29.8%.Balance Sheet and Cash FlowApple's cash and cash equivalents (and short-term marketable securities) were $60.5 billion at the end of the quarter
column36: compared with $67.2 billion at fiscal 2016-end. Long-term debt was $73.6 billion compared with $75.4 billion at the end of fiscal 2016.For the quarter
column37: cash generated from operating activities was $27.1 billion.Apple returned about $15 billion in capital returns this quarter through dividends and share repurchases. Apple also said that it has so far returned $201 billion out of the $250 billion capital returns program announced in April last year.The company also declared its quarterly dividend of 57 cents per share payable on Feb 16 to shareholders of record as on Feb13.GuidanceFor the second quarter of fiscal 2017
column38: Apple forecasts revenues in a range of $51.5 billion to $53.5 billion.Gross margin is expected within 38% to 39%
column39: while operating expenses are projected within $6.5 billion to $6.6 billion. Other income/ (expense) is likely to be $400 million
column40: while tax rate is expected to be 26%.Our TakeBetter-than-expected iPhone sales have definitely come as a respite. But the macroeconomic headwinds remain for now

column42: one of the high-growth regions for Apple. Also

column47: Apple sales in India grew approximately 50% over the prior fiscal.Apple's Services business is also expected to remain strong as it is mostly dependent on the already installed Apple devices. Also
column48: in the long run

column51: given its loyal customer base. Further

Global sales unexpectedly fell 0.5%.After the close

column20: coming in at 78.3 million vs. 74.8 million last year and the 77 million that analysts expected returning the critical business segment to year-over-year growth. IPad shipments were weak
column21: however
column22: at 13.1 million versus 16.1 million last year and 15.5 million expected. China revenue was soft as well

column25: however
column26: over the health of the iPhone business after a number of quarters of disappointing results and a recent report in the Nikkei that production could be cut by 10% due to sluggish sales. Management also issued downside guidance

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Pops Following Vindicating Q1 Earnings;January 31
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) needed a strong showing in its recently completed quarter
column5: in the shadow of three straight quarters of waning revenue and waning earnings. It got it
column6: sending AAPL stock up 2.6% in Tuesday's after-hours trading.makeAd('4'
column8: 'mktsnews'
column9: 'vanguard'
column11: '');Source: AppleFor the company's first fiscal quarter ending in December
column12: Apple reported income of $3.36 per share on revenue of $78.4 billion. Both were better than analyst expectations for a profit of $3.22 per share on revenue of $77.42 billion. AAPL posted income of $3.28 per share in the same quarter a year earlier
column13: when it generated $75.87 billion in sales.CEO Tim Cook commented on the results:""We're thrilled to report that our holiday quarter results generated Apple's highest quarterly revenue ever
column14: and broke multiple records along the way. We sold more iPhones than ever before and set all-time revenue records for iPhone
column15: Services
column16: Mac and Apple Watch.""CFO Luca Maestri added:""Our outstanding business performance resulted in a new all-time record for earnings per share
column17: and over $27 billion in operating cash flow. We returned nearly $15 billion to investors through share repurchases and dividends during the quarter
column18: bringing cumulative payments through our capital return program to over $200 billion.""Apple EarningsWhile AAPL stock has been a strong growth machine since unveiling the first iPhone a little over a decade ago
column19: per-share profits have been lower on a year-over-year basisin each of the prior three quarters. The same goes for revenue. Q1's numbers largely rekindle confidence in the company's prospects.Almost as important as Apple's top and bottom lines for the first fiscal quarter of the year was the number of iPhones it sold during the accounting period in question.The Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryBroadly speaking
column20: the pace of sales growth of the iPhone has been slowing as saturation and better competition chip away at Apple's prowess in the market. TheiPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus were released in September
column21: before the end of the previous quarter.The bulk of the device's sales
column22: though
column23: came in the subsequent quarter beginning in October. During that three-month span
column24: the company sold 78.2 million of the smartphone ($58.4 billion worth of the device)
column25: versus expectations of 77.3 million. The company didn't indicate how many of those were iPhone 7 phones
column26: but Cowen & Co. had forecast 58.5 million iPhone 7's were sold during fiscal Q1.The company's fast-growing digital product arm - music
column27: video and apps - drove respectable revenue during the quarter as well.Digital content as a revenue source had not been a priority for AAPL until sales of Macs
column28: iPhones and iPads began to slow down last year. The companyturned up the heat on this line last year
column29: however
column30: and has turned the unit into Apple's second-biggest piece of revenue pie. Last quarter it contributed $7.17 billion worth of sales
column31: up 18% from year-ago levels
column32: and accounting for 9% of total sales. Analysts had only expected $7.07 billion worth of services revenue.Apple is evenmulling the creation of its own original television shows and movies
column33: following in the footsteps of on-demand video rivalsNetflix
column34: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) andAmazon.com
column35: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).Geographically
column36: the Americas continue to provide the bulk of Apple's revenue
column37: though China and its neighbors provided the majority of revenuegrowthlast quarter.The Americas accounted for $31.9 billion in Apple's sales last quarter
column38: up 58%. China put $16.2 billion worth of revenue on the table
column39: up 85% year-over-year. Japan and the rest of the Asia-Pacific area only contributed $5.9 billion in sales
column40: but that tally was up 119% versus the tally from the same quarter a year earlier.Advanced Micro Devices
column41: Inc. (AMD): The Turnaround Is Legit!The future of Apple's business in China hangs in the balance. President Donald Trump's policy plans are said by some to be the beginning of a trade war.Not only would that make iPhones more difficult to sell in China
column42: but would strain Apple's relationships with key manufacturers of iPhone
column43: iPad and Mac components.Bottom Line for AAPL StockLooking ahead
column44: Apple anticipates revenue of between $51.5 billion and $53.5 billion for the quarter currently underway. The company doesn't provide earnings guidance
column45: but as of the latest look

column47: and those estimates may well be adjusted higher before the second quarter numbers are posted.As of this writing

column5: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTurnarounds usually aren't neat

column8: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) just keeps building momentum as the semidconductor firm continues to remake itself. Fourth-quarter earnings out Tuesday evening launched AMD stock by another 5% in after-hours trading

column11: which were up 15.4% year-over-year. While earnings were in line with Wall Street expectations

column13: AMD would be looking at an 18% increase to$989 million- well above analyst expectations for $964 million.The Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruarySome additional highlights from AMD's fourth quarter:The Computing and Graphics unit saw its revenues jump by 28% to $600 million.The cash balance increased by $6 million
column14: for a total of $1.26 billion.The company announced the brand of its new chips
column15: called Ryzen. One example of the technology's power: Combined with its Vega GPU
column16: it allows a desktop to runStar Wars: Battlefront - Rogue Oneat 60 frames per second in 4K.The company announced a collaboration withAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column17: NASDAQ:GOOG) for the Radeon GPU technology for cloud computing.AMD announced Radeon Instinct
column18: which allows for high-end deep learning. The product is expected to hit the markets in the first half of this year.AMD Is Primed for GrowthUDPATE:Management typically is conservative when it comes to earnings guidance
column19: so we can anticipate nice traction in 2017
column20: driven by Ryzen. For the most part
column21: the technology looks like it has better performance and power usage compared toIntel Corporation's(NASDAQ:INTC) 8-core
column22: 3.2GHz Core i7-6900K that came out in May - and it's cheaper.No surprise
column23: then
column24: that Alphabet has teamed up with AMD. But don't expect the large-cap tech partnerships to end there
column25: and instead expect them to extend to the likes ofFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) andSalesforce.com
column26: inc.(NYSE:CRM)? Headline-making deals like this could very well drive AMD stock in 2017.From CEO Lisa Su:""As we enter 2017
column27: we are well  positioned and on-track to deliver our strongest set of high-performance computing and graphics products in more than a decade.""So
column28: should bulls exercise any caution?Well
column29: AMD stock has already staged an amazing rally
column30: and yes
column31: we probably won't see a repeat of 2016's triple-digit gains.After all
column32: Advanced Micro Devices' market cap is now close to $10 billion. Thus
column33: it would need to generate a hefty $450 million in net earnings to get at a 25X multiple. But Wall Street frankly might not care.AMD stock has become an excellent momentum play. Shares have become a way to play some of the hottest markets in technology
column34: including augmented reality and artificial intelligence.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Pops Following Vindicating Q1 EarningsAs long as growth keeps perking up

column37: shares would see price resistance at around $11.50
column38: then $12 - its multiyear peak.Meanwhile
column39: AMD stock is far from gassed

column1: Tuesday Apple Rumors: Future Version of iOS May Not Support 32-Bit Apps;January 31
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is bad news for 32-bit iOS apps . Today
column5: we'll look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor Tuesday.makeArticleAd();32-Bit Apps:A notification in the iOS 10.3 beta warns that 32-bit apps are on their way out
column6: reportsMacRumors. The notifications pops up when the user goes to open a 32-bit app in the beta. It states that the app will not work on future versions of iOS. It's unknown is this means that iOS 11 won't support 32-bit apps. As it is now
column7: the iOS 10.3.2 beta still supports the apps. AAPL started forcing developers to make 64-bit apps in February 2015
column8: but some apps not updated after that haven't been affected by this change.Colonge Store:Apple is reportedly preparing to open its second store in Colonge
column9: Germany
column10: AppleInsidernotes. The tech company has announced that it is opening a second store in the city. However
column11: photos taken of a building show a lit AAPL logo hidden behind tarps. Inside work on the building can't be seen due to tarps blocking the way. Current rumors claims that the store will open its doors to customers for the first time in the second half of February.Nintendo Games:Nintendo Co.
column12: Ltd (ADR)(OTCMKTS:NTDOY)is preparing to release more games on iOS devices
column13: reports9to5Mac. Nintendo will be releasingFire Emblem Heroeson the iPhone and iPad on Feb. 2
column14: 2017. It is also planning to release the mobileAnimal Crossinggame to iOS devices in the near future. However
column15: there has been a delay. This delay has the game not coming out until the company's next fiscal year
column16: which starts in April. NTDOY previously planned to release the game during its current fiscal year.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postTuesday Apple Rumors: Future Version of iOS May Not Support 32-Bit Appsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 ETFs For True Total Market Coverage;January 31
column3: 01:14:06 PM EDT;"ETF investors often spend an inordinate amount of time trying to find the best spot in the market.  They love focusing on specific sectors
column4: factors
column5: or tactical strategies that are showing a promising edge.  However
column6: there is often a fundamental need for simple and diversified stock exposure at the lowest possible cost.This type of core foundation is the essence behind total stock market funds.  They allow you to stay correlated with the broadest possible indexes and charge expenses that are so fractional as to be almost non-existent.  They embody the true spirit of the ETF philosophy in their liquidity
column7: tax efficiency
column8: and transparency.The largest and most well-known of this group is theVanguard Total Stock Market ETF(VTI).  Over the years
column9: Ive lost track of how many awards and commendations this fund has received.  Its true value proposition is the simplicity of a single vehicle for complete U.S. stock market coverage with the lowest possible tracking error.makeAd('4'
column11: 'mktsnews'
column12: 'vanguard'
column14: '');VTI owns a basket of 3
column15: 592 publicly traded securities across the large
column16: mid
column17: and small-cap verticals.  You cant get much more diversified than that.  The fund is market-cap weighted to give the largest stocks a greater share of its $70 billion asset base.  Nevertheless
column18: the top holding
column19: Apple Inc(AAPL) only accounts for 2.5% of the total portfolio.  That leaves a large swath of exposure to be distributed through the thousands of remaining holdings.One of the highly touted advantages of VTI is its ultra-low expense ratio of 0.05%.  Thats just $50 for every $100
column20: 000 invested on an annual basis.  The minimal expenses ensure this fund is appropriate as a long-term position in virtually any type of equity portfolio.The next largest fund by size is theSchwab US Broad Market ETF(SCHB)
column21: which has $7.7 billion under management.  This ETF tracks a basket of 2
column22: 000 stocks domiciled in the U.S. through all market-cap segments.SCHB claims one of the lowest industry expense ratios at just 0.03% annually.  This fee has been incrementally lowered multiple times over the years
column23: which adds to its attractiveness for long-term investors.  Its even conceivable that one day this ETF will charge as low as one basis point per year for access to its diversified stock portfolio.Last
column24: but certainly not least
column25: is theiShares Core S&P Total U.S. Stock Market ETF(ITOT).  This fund shares traits of both VTI and SCHB in its overall makeup.  It charges an expense ratio of 0.03% and contains more than 3
column26: 600 underlying holdings.  ITOT has $6.7 billion in assets under management and has been in place since 2004.While all three of these funds have minor differences in their structure
column27: they must ultimately be judged on their results. The 5-year price chart below shows that the returns for all three are almost indistinguishable from each other.That level of correlation is a dependable statistic for those that are agonizing over which is the best fund to pick.  There really is no wrong answer here.  Although
column28: the decision may be made easier if one of these options is available transaction-free from your brokerage platform.  That would truly minimize total costs and allow you to scale in or out of any shares with the lowest possible friction.The Bottom LineTotal market ETFs are solid tools for both experienced investors and those who are just starting out on this journey.  They provide a truly simple path to a diversified stock allocation without having to agonize over various investment styles.  Removing complexity from the equation can result in better execution and a much greater chance for long-term success.Disclosure: At the time this article was written
column29: the author owned shares of ITOT."
