column1: Can Apple's (AAPL) "Find my Airpod" Feature Really Help?;January 26
column3: 10:25:00 AM EDT;"On TuesdayApple Inc. (AAPL)announced its iOS 10.3 update with a special feature
column4: apparently called ""Find my Airpods""
column5: that will help to track misplaced Airpods.Powered by a new W1 chip
column6: the Airpods are in line with Apple's vision of wireless future. Apparently
column7: its best feature seems to be the use of sensors to detect if the plugs have been inserted in both the ears. However
column8: since its launch
column9: Airpod has been a hot topic of discussion on FacebookFBand TwitterTWTRgiven the chances of it being misplaced easily due to its size.Per media reports
column10: Apple's announcement can be seen as an answer to users' request to make a feature that will help them find these small AirPods. Due to its small size
column11: the Airpod cannot accommodate a built-in GPS system. Therefore
column12: the latest feature is tailored to locate misplaced Airpods that are within the Bluetooth range of an iPhone or iPad.Then again
column13: the problem remains that the exact location of the Airpod cannot be determined with the feature and only the last connected location will show up on the connected iOS device
column14: add further media reports. Additionally
column15: the feature is capable of activating a sound from the Airpod to indicate its location. However
column16: these features are useless once the Airpod's battery is exhausted.Apple Inc. Price and ConsensusApple Inc. Price and Consensus|Apple Inc. QuoteApple's fortunes have been tied to its most important offering
column17: the iPhone
column18: which alone contributed about 60% of its total revenue in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016.However
column19: since the last two quarters
column20: the demand for this device has been soft owing to global macroeconomic weakness
column21: especially due to currency volatility and declining commodity prices in some key regions across the globe (about 60% of Apple revenues come from International markets).The Airpod had been one of the key attractions of the iPhone 7 series. Reportedly
column22: since the launch of Airpods in December
column23: Apple has been on the top of the headphone market that boasts names likes SonySNE
column24: Bose
column25: JBL and others. Although Apple has refrained from posting its official sales figures
column26: the market reports indicate positive impact of Airpod sales on first quarter results.In the past one year
column27: Apple's shares are up 19.98%
column28: compared with the ZacksComputer Miniindustry's increase of 21.41%

column9: 09:30:00 AM EDT;"For Immediate ReleaseChicago
column10: IL - January 26
column11: 2017-Zacks Equity ResearchhighlightsBroadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO-Free Report)as the Bull of the Day andValeant Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:VRX-Free Report)as the Bear of the Day. In addition
column12: Zacks Equity Research provides analysis onApple (NASDAQ:AAPL-Free Report)
column13: Amazon(NASDAQ:AMZN-Free Report) andNetflix(NASDAQ:NFLX-Free Report).Here is a synopsis of all four stocks:Bull of the Day:Seems it was only a month ago I writing aboutBroadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO-Free Report)as the Bull of the Day and explaining why I've been strongly recommending and trading the stock since 2014 from $70.makeArticleAd();And it's true. I did choose AVGO on December 22 when it was trading around $180. Here's how I described this powerhouse technology company in that report...3 Key SegmentsThough Broadcom is generally classified as a semiconductor designer and developer
column14: its solutions serve telecom and enterprise networking customers in the build-out of data centers and high-speed
column15: broadband communications. I can't say for sure ifAT&T
column16: CiscoorAlphabetare customers
column17: but I would be surprised if they weren't.Thus about half of Broadcom's sales come from the Wired Infrastructure segment which has been seeing steady double-digit growth as these big customers transition to the 100 Gigabit Ethernet protocol.Approximately 30% of Broadcom's revenues come from its Wireless Communications division which serves top-end mobile smart-device makers likeApplewith radio frequency (RF) chips
column18: amplifiers
column19: and FBAR technology filters. Broadcom FBAR (Film Bulk Acoustic Resonator) filters are a form of bulk acoustic wave (BAW) filter that have superior performance with steeper rejection curves compared to surface acoustic wave (SAW) filters.The third major segment at Broadcom is Enterprise Storage
column20: which connects back with many customers from the Wired division and supplies just under 20% of revenues. The company's products enable the high-speed movement of digital data with a secure connection among multiple PCs
column21: servers and storage devices such as hard disk drives and solid state drives.While AVGO's Wireless business is ""dependent"" on Apple
column22: that's not exactly a bad problem to have. The coming next wave of 5G technology will keep both companies rolling in sales growth.And Broadcom's largest business
column23: the Wired segment
column24: is very busy meeting the demand of companies building high-speed
column25: broadband networks
column26: especially with the data-hogging loads of video and the storage requirements of the Internet of Things.Bear of the Day:I don't enjoy kicking this once-beloved company when it's down
column27: butValeant Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:VRX-Free Report)has it coming (again) as earnings estimates slip.In the past week
column28: another investment bank revised lower their EPS projection for this year
column29: knocking the the Zacks Consensus down to $5.17 from $5.30.And in the past 90 days
column30: the profit outlook has fallen from $7.70. This puts annual growth at -5.6% after a 2016 that could end up at over -30% ""growth.""This is why VRX shares are in the cellar of the Zacks Rank again.But it doesn't mean you should run out and sell yours only $1 from multi-year lows. The company is still projected to deliver nearly $9.2 billion in sales this year with hundreds of products and steady earners like Jublia and Wellbutrin.The unknown risks are what happens with any legal investigations or the company's massive debt load. The current debt-to-equity ratio is over 7X for this $4.7 billion company and the debt-to-capital ratio may be over 87X.Analysts Weigh In On the Debt IssueOn January 11
column31: Canaccord Genuity analyst Neil Maruoka was encouraged by Valeant's recent moves to address the leverage...""Valeant has taken its first significant steps towards de-levering its balance sheet
column32: announcing the divestiture of Dendreon and several dermatology brands (including CereVe) for combined cash consideration of ~$2.1 billion.""The analyst noted that the downside of this move is that the company may be forced to sell more quality drug franchises like CereVe
column33: thus hurting sales and operating cash flow. ""Following these divestitures
column34: we estimate that Valeant will have total debt of $28.3 billion remaining
column35: representing a leverage ratio of 6.9x forward EBITDA (down from 7.1x previously).""On January 20
column36: Deutsche Bank reiterated their Hold rating on VRX shares and dropped their price target from $24 to $20. Analyst Gregg Gilbert talked about the company's challenges...""We expect VRX to provide its 2017 outlook sometime between now and when it reports 4Q results (date not yet set). Recall that management provided 'hand signals' on its 3Q call in November that revenue and EBITDA would be down in 2017 vs. 2016. In anticipation of this event
column37: we have updated our model to reflect recent developments and management commentary. The key elements of our changes relate to recently-announced divestitures
column38: loss of exclusivity (LOE) for several products in 2016/17
column39: and FX headwinds.""Additional content:Apple 'Hopeful' About Future iPhone Manufacturing in     IndiaOn Wednesday
column40: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL-Free Report)executives met with government officials of India to discuss plans about manufacturing iPhones in the country.Like many tech corporations-think Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN-Free Report) and Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX-Free Report) - Apple is eager to begin assembling its iPhone in India
column41: which has become one of the world's fastest growing smartphone markets in recent years. Apple currently only has a tiny market share in the country
column42: and is ready to start bolstering its stagnate global sales. The company even applied to open retail stores in India last year.""We've been working hard to develop our operations in India
column43: Apple said in a brief statement. ""We appreciate the constructive and open dialogue we've had with government about further expanding our local operations.""The tech giant's plans to set up an iPhone production plant was initially reported on byTimes of India. The newspaper reported that the factory would be built in partnership with Taiwan-based manufacturer Wistron.According toCNNMoney
column44: India has over 300 million smartphone users
column45: or 18% more than last year. Apple
column46: then
column47: has much to gain if it can build a successful iPhone production plant in the country. However
column48: Apple's products are not cheap
column49: and most of India's 1.3 billion people have an average annual income of $1

column1: Facebook Inc (FB) Hires Former Google Exec to Lead Oculus;January 26
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc's(NASDAQ:FB) virtual reality division Oculus has had a rough six months
column5: but it looks as though the company is ready to to push VR in 2017 and turn things around. CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Facebook last night to announce thatHugo Barra will be joining FB to lead VR efforts
column6: including Oculus. If the name sounds familiar it should. Barra is very well known in the technology industry.makeArticleAd();Source: FacebookSo who is Hugo Barra? He was in the news just last week when it was revealed he was leaving Chinese consumer technology giantXiaomi.He was hired in 2013 to lead that company's efforts to polish its image in western markets and help push its products into the U.S. market. At the time Barra said he was returning to his Silicon Valley roots
column7: but gave no details.What Does Hugo Barra Bring to FB?Prior to Xiaomi
column8: he served asAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column9: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google vice president of Android product management.In his announcement of Barra's hire
column10: Zuckerberg wrote:""I'm excited that Hugo Barra is joining Facebook to lead all of our virtual reality efforts
column11: including our Oculus team. Hugo's in China right now
column12: so here we are together in VR. It seems fitting.I've known Hugo for a long time
column13: starting when he helped develop the Android operating system
column14: to the last few years he's worked at Xiaomi in Beijing bringing innovative devices to millions of people. Hugo shares my belief that virtual and augmented reality will be the next major computing platform.""FB's Oculus ChallengesWhen Facebook bought Oculus for $2 billion in 2014
column15: the prospects for its new virtual reality division seemed limitless. But for the last six months
column16: the division has been struggling.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy"" 2017Founder Palmer Luckey was bringing inbad press over his political views
column17: complaints over the highprices for its Oculus Rift headsetand the new Touch Controllers continued
column18: andSony Corp (ADR)(NYSE:SNE) unexpectedly began to gain traction with both consumers and game developers with its much more affordable Playstation VR. In December
column19: Oculus CEO Brendan Iribe stepped down. Now
column20: FB and Luckey aretied up in a lawsuitclaiming the Oculus founder stole trade secrets and violated copyrights in order to develop his Oculus Rift VR headset.On top of all this
column21: the hype over virtual reality is beginning to fade. After being a major part of past Consumer Electronics shows
column22: there was a feeling thatVR wasn't particularly compelling at CES 2017.In short
column23: it's understandable why FB wants to kickstart Oculus. An industry veteran like Hugo Barra -someone who is experienced in leading a critical division in a technology giant and skilled at promotion - may well be the answer.Kickstarting OculusWhen Barra takes over at Oculus
column24: there are a few immediate challenges to take on. The lawsuit will have to be dealt with
column25: but FB lawyers will be able to manage most of that.The bigger issue in terms of getting consumers to buy into the Oculus rift is pricing. The Oculus Rift already has mindshare as the VR headset people think of. But where the Oculus Rift was once pretty much the only game in town
column26: every major consumer technology company - exceptApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) - is offering virtual reality gear
column27: and it's almost always cheaper.Apple Inc. New iPads Might Be Late to the Party (AAPL)That wouldn't be such a big deal if you were looking at $100 versus $75. But an Oculus Rift plus Touch Controllers goes for $798. Then you need a reasonably powerful PC (many computer owners would have to upgrade)
column28: which is at least another $1
column29: 000. In comparison
column30: a complete Sony Playstation VR system (including the PS4) can be had for about $800. However
column31: the Playstation VR headset is compatible with the original PS4 - which many gamers already own
column32: so that brings their investment to just $500.Largely as a result of those cost differences
column33: it'sestimated Sony will have sold over 745
column34: 000 Playstation VR systems in 2016
column35: while projections are for the Oculus Rift to hit just 355
column36: 000.The hire of Hugo Barra sets the stage for FB to aggressively promote the technical superiority of its Oculus virtual reality technology over that used by competitors like Sony. It's also a good move in promoting developer relations in an effort to boost the Oculus' lead in compelling VR content. And if he can find some wiggle room to get Oculus Rift pricing down a bit
column37: Barra stands a good chance of turning things around for Facebook's virtual reality division in 2017.As of this writing
column38: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 Things Apple Inc. (AAPL) MUST Do to Soar in 2017Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon and Google's TurfThe postFacebook Inc (FB) Hires Former Google Exec to Lead Oculusappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple (AAPL) Q1 Earnings: What's in the Cards this Time?;January 26
column4: Inc.AAPLis set to report its first-quarter fiscal 2017 results on Jan 31. Last quarter
column5: it posted a 0.60% positive earnings surprise. column1: Western Digital (WDC) Beats Q2 Earnings; '17 View Positive;January 26
column3: 07:26:00 AM EDT;"Western Digital Corp.WDCreported second-quarter 2017 adjusted earnings of $2.30 per share
column4: which increased 33.7% from the year-ago quarter. Earnings were much better than management's revised guided range of $2.10-$2.15 per share.makeArticleAd();Moreover
column5: including stock-based compensation
column6: earnings were $1.98 per share
column7: which beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 33 cents. Further
column8: revenues of almost $4.89 billion surged 47.4% year over year and comfortably surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $4.75 billion.Western Digital witnessed strong demand for both hard drive and NAND-based products from all categories of customers
column9: largely driven by cloud and mobility based applications
column10: as well as better than expected PC demand in the reported quarter.Western Digital Corporation Price
column11: Consensus and EPS     SurpriseWestern Digital Corporation Price
column12: Consensus and   EPS Surprise|Western Digital Corporation QuoteSegment Revenue DetailsClient devices (49.5% of total revenue) surged 52.9% year over year to $2.42 billion. The revenue synergies from SanDisk acquisition benefitted results in the quarter. Management noted that increasing storage capacities in mobile phones and market preference for client SSDs are long-term tailwinds for this business.Client solutions (22% of total revenue) increased a whopping 134.4% to $1.08 billion. Robust holiday season sales drove results. The company noted that the combined revenue contribution from new products such as iXpand and dual USB drives also grew in the quarter.During the quarter
column13: Western Digital announced new retail products including the four terabyte My Passport
column14: eight terabyte My Book for the PC and a new four terabyte hard drive for Apple'sAAPLMacintosh. During the quarter
column15: Western Digital commenced retail shipments and OEM sampling of its 64-layer product.Data center devices and solutions (28.5% of total revenue) increased 9.2% to $1.39 billion on the back of strong demand for high capacity storage devices. Petabyte growth of almost 40% year over year for capacity optimized hard drive was in line with management expectations. Solid adoption of 10 Terabyte third generation Helium drive was also noted in the quarter.During the quarter
column16: Western Digital shipped 44.8 million HDDs at an average selling price (ASP) of $62
column17: up from $61 reported in the year-ago quarter. However
column18: reported shipments of 44.762 million were down from 49.688 million in the year-ago quarter.Western Digital's market share in the total addressable market (TAM) came in at 39.9% compared with 43.2% in the year-ago quarter.Operating DetailsAdjusted gross margin expanded 810 basis points (bps) year over year to 36.4%. The figure was better than management's guidance of 35%. The expansion was driven by lower product cost and pricing improvement.Reported operating expenses
column19: as percentage of revenues climbed 50 bps to 20.2%
column20: owing to 20 bps increase in research and development (R&D) expense and 10 bps growth in selling
column21: general and administrative (SG&A) expense.As a result
column22: adjusted operating margin expanded 590 bps to 17.6% in the reported quarter.Interest expense was $224 million a massive increase from $7 million reported in the year-ago quarter.Acquisition SynergiesWestern Digital stated that it is on track to achieve the $800 million of annualized savings from the HGST integration by the end of calendar 2017. The company achieved $175 million of cost of revenue synergies and $300 million of operating expense synergies each on an annual run rate basis at the end of the reported quarter.In terms of SanDisk integration
column23: at the end of second quarter the company realized synergies of approximately $135 million on an annual run-rate basis. This is in line with the company's 18-month target of achieving $500 million of total run rate synergies on an annualized basis.Balance Sheet/Cash FlowAs of Dec 30
column25: cash and cash equivalents were $4.94 billion up from $4.33 billion as of Sep 30. Long-term debt during the quarter was $12.94 billion down from $13.06 billion at the end of previous quarter.During the quarter
column26: Western Digital generated $1.06 billion in cash from operations compared with $440 million in the previous quarter.GuidanceFor third-quarter fiscal 2017
column27: revenues are expected to remain flat on a sequential basis.Adjusted gross margin is expected to be 38% backed by continued favorable pricing and product mix across the company's businesses. Total operating expenses are expected to be approximately $800 million.Interest expense is anticipated to be almost $205 million.Management expects adjusted earnings to be in the range of $2.00-$2.10 per share for the third quarter.Our TakeWe believe that the shift toward non-PC applications
column28: secular growth of digital data and growing exposure to the small and medium business space are the long-term positives for Western Digital. The company's growing footprint in the automotive as well as the connected home and industrial categories is significantly positive
column29: in our view.We remain encouraged by the company's launch of a string of storage devices under the mobile and cloud segment. Continued investments in product innovation could result in flattish margins in the near term.Further
column30: Western Digital's entry into the wireless devices market comes at a time when storage services related to smartphones and tablets are witnessing large-scale adoption. These factors are anticipated to be growth catalysts
column31: going forward.Moreover
column32: the SanDisk acquisition not only expands Western Digital's offerings in the SSD segment but also provides a competitive edge against peers such as Seagate TechnologySTX.We note that Western Digital shares have outperformed the ZacksComputer Storage Devicesindustry in the past one-year. While shares gained 80.9%
column33: the industry advanced 22.4% in the same period. We expect the momentum to persist given the impressive result and positive guidance in the rest of fiscal 2017.Zacks Rank & Key PicksWestern Digital currently has a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank stocks   here. column1: Bull of the Day: Broadcom (AVGO);January 26
column3: 07:00:00 AM EDT;"makeZacksArticleAd();Seems it was only a month ago I writing aboutBroadcom (AVGO)as the Bull of the Day and explaining why I've been strongly recommending and trading the stock since 2014 from $70.And it's true. I did choose AVGO on December 22 when it was trading around $180. Here's how I described this powerhouse technology company in that report...3 Key SegmentsThough Broadcom is generally classified as a semiconductor designer and developer
column4: its solutions serve telecom and enterprise networking customers in the build-out of data centers and high-speed
column5: broadband communications. I can't say for sure ifAT&T(T)
column6: Cisco(CSCO)
column7: orAlphabet(GOOGL) are customers
column8: but I would be surprised if they weren't.Thus about half of Broadcom's sales come from the Wired Infrastructure segment which has been seeing steady double-digit growth as these big customers transition to the 100 Gigabit Ethernet protocol.Approximately 30% of Broadcom's revenues come from its Wireless Communications division which serves top-end mobile smart-device makers likeApple (AAPL)with radio frequency (RF) chips
column9: amplifiers
column10: and FBAR technology filters. Broadcom FBAR (Film Bulk Acoustic Resonator) filters are a form of bulk acoustic wave (BAW) filter that have superior performance with steeper rejection curves compared to surface acoustic wave (SAW) filters.The third major segment at Broadcom is Enterprise Storage
column11: which connects back with many customers from the Wired division and supplies just under 20% of revenues. The company's products enable the high-speed movement of digital data with a secure connection among multiple PCs
column12: servers and storage devices such as hard disk drives and solid state drives.While AVGO's Wireless business is ""dependent"" on Apple
column13: that's not exactly a bad problem to have. The coming next wave of 5G technology will keep both companies rolling in sales growth.And Broadcom's largest business
column14: the Wired segment
column15: is very busy meeting the demand of companies building high-speed
column16: broadband networks
column17: especially with the data-hogging loads of video and the storage requirements of the Internet of Things.I Have $250... Do I Hear $300?So what has changed in a month to make Broadcom the Bull of the Day again?Simply this: the stock took off over 10% to new highs in the past six sessions as a couple of analysts bolstered their view of this must-own tech ""arms dealer."" While I've been following fund managers into AVGO for nearly 3 years
column18: the growth story is not over.On January 18
column19: RBC Capital analyst Amit Daryanani reiterated his Top Pick rating on AVGO shares and raised his view of the company's long term earnings potential to $17 EPS on the heels of the acquisition of Brocade (BRCD). Here's what he had to say...""Our analysis suggests the underlying EPS power of AVGO increases materially post BRCD (especially assuming they raise $1.5-2.0B from networking & real estate sales). We think AVGO could achieve >$17.00 of EPS by FY19 (prior $16) and the stock should work in an upside scenario to $250+.""Oddly
column20: the analyst did not raise his existing price target from $200.So we'll leave that to a bolder fan of the company...On January 24
column21: Morgan Stanley analyst Craig Hettenback raised his price target on Broadcom to $240 from $210
column22: and obviously reiterated his Overweight rating. Here's the MS view...""Increasing our PT to $240 from $210 and highlighting a bull case valuation of $300. Our PT is based on a 15X P/E on CY18 EPS
column23: representing a turn increase from the current multiple but still a conservative 20% discount to the high end Semiconductor peers and 15% below the market. AVGO's multiple has been flat (100% of stock appreciation has been driven by growth in EPS) compared to a roughly 2x turn increase in semiconductor stocks
column24: with investors unwilling to pay up for acquired growth.""However
column25: we now have increased conviction that clearer focus on its outperforming core business
column26: materially higher cash returns and ongoing margin expansion will drive a re-rating over the next 6-12 months.""The combination of Avago and Broadcom is unmatched in Networking (40% sales) in our view
column27: which has positive implications for both growth (share gains) and profitability. We also think the company remains well positioned in RF to exploit the next growth driver of carrier aggregation
column28: leveraging its leadership in premium filters and multiplexers.""The AVGO CampaignAnd there you have an update on the continuing saga that I call ""The AVGO Campaign."" It tells you what works and makes you money in a bull market: finding earnings momentum winners that you know institutions will continue to buy until the cycle ends.Consider AVGO your ""playbook stock"" for how to use the Zacks Rank to swing trade fundamentally-strong companies quarter after quarter.You can find out more by following me in myTAZR Traderservice.Zacks' best stocks under $10As a Zacks Rank #1 Strong Buy

column1: Qualcomm (QCOM) Earnings: Why QCOM Stock Is A Buy;January 25

This make Qualcomm  from a valuation perspective  easy to like at current levels. Ill get back to that in a moment. Lets go through he numbers.makeArticleAd();Forthe quarter that ended December

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings Preview;January 25
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) stock has had an impressive run over the past few years. Heading into Thursday's fiscal second quarter earnings report
column5: MSFT stock is right near an all-time high
column6: having increased about 150% over the past few years.Source:Via MicrosoftWhat's interesting about the gains for such a large stock - MSFT is the third-most valuable company on U.S. markets
column7: behind onlyApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) - is that they haven't been based on Microsoft earnings. Microsoft's EPS was $2.73 in fiscal 2012
column8: and $2.79 in fiscal 2016.makeArticleAd();Rather
column9: the multiple investors assign to MSFT stock has expanded. It has more than doubled
column10: in fact.That multiple expansion has come from increasing confidence toward Microsoft'sfutureearnings potential
column11: most notably in mobile and cloud. Where investors four to five years ago saw a fading giant whose earnings were likely to decline
column12: Microsoft now looks like a sleeping giant. And investors clearly believe the company's self-described ""mobile first
column13: cloud first"" strategy is going to push Microsoft earnings up - at some point.It's in that context that the market will analyze the Microsoft earnings report due on Thursday.Microsoft's Growth Isn't ThereYetIt's always dangerous for an investor to believe that the numbers don't matter
column14: but in the case of MSFT stock
column15: the numbers really aren't the most important thing right now.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy""     2017Analyst consensus - informed in large part by Microsoft earnings guidance - doesn't predict a particularly impressive second quarter earnings report. The Street expects EPS to rise just a penny year-over-year
column16: which given share repurchases
column17: implies that Microsoft's total net profits actually will be lower in Q2 FY17 than they were ago.  Revenue is estimated to fall almost 2% year-over-year.Microsoft's guidance projects growth in its Productivity & Business and Intelligent Cloud segments
column18: but a sharp decline in More Personal Computing.That shouldn't be surprising. Office 365 growth has helped business revenue
column19: and the Azure platform continues to be a worthy
column20: if still much smaller
column21: competitor to Amazon Web Services in cloud. It's the potential for success in those products that has offset fears about continuing pressure on revenue from Windows
column22: as PC sales decline and mobile usage increases.Indeed
column23: the gain in MSFT stock from $27 to $63 has come mostly from the transition.The fears of Windows losses that led MSFT stock to be valued around 10x EPS in 2013 have turned to optimism toward growth in Azure
column24: Office 365
column25: Enterprise Mobility and other areas. That optimism has pushed the same stock to be valued at about 21x FY17 earnings.So it seems unlikely that investors will focus on the major headline numbers coming out of the Microsoft earnings report. A beat or miss of a penny or two on earnings likely isn't going to drive the market's reaction to the report - particularly if that weakness comes from Windows. Rather
column26: the focus is going to be on the growing
column27: smaller
column28: businesses
column29: most notably Azure.There's a reason Microsoft has steadily expanded its disclosure around Azure and cloud growth: That's where investor attention has been. And it seems likely that's where investor attention will stay coming out of the Q2 Microsoft earnings report.What to Watch For in Microsoft EarningsInvestors seem likely to have some patience with a modest miss in the Microsoft earnings report
column30: as expectations remain relatively low. The company still is getting out from under its deal withNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK)
column31: and layoffs this year should provide a boost to margins over the next few quarters. Wall Street in particular isn't expecting growth to pick up until fiscal 2018
column32: where sales are projected to grow more than 6% against a rate under 2% in fiscal 2017.So what seems to be important in the Q2 Microsoft earnings report is whether the base of that growth is intact.While Azure is estimated to generate just 3% of total revenue
column33: accordingto analyst firm MKM Partners
column34: its growth rate certainly will be watched closely. After a 140% increase in Q2 FY16
column35: and 116% last quarter
column36: any slowdown seems likely to hurt the stock. But another 100%-plus figure would give further evidence that Azure is a worthy competitor to AWS
column37: and support the current MSFT stock price.The cloud business as a whole - including Office 365 and Dynamics
column38: which is trying to take share fromSalesforce.com
column39: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) - will be another area of post-earnings analysis.Here's Why Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock     Will Hit $75What does that mean for Microsoft stock coming out of the Microsoft earnings report?Overall
column40: it means that the quarter seems likely to be judged more on ""feel"" than on the hard numbers. Even though cloud and mobile still aren't the majority of MSFT revenue or earnings
column41: they are the cornerstones of the Microsoft strategy going forward. And for now
column42: it's relatively clear that the market is content to wait for those sales and profits - as long as it continues to trust in that strategy.If Microsoft can deliver another earnings report that shows growth is on the horizon
column43: MSFT stock likely will rise - even if the headline numbers aren't perfect. But if there's any sort of stumble in either cloud or mobile
column44: that investor patience could reverse - quickly.As of this writing
column45: Vince Martin did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW     Still Bargains7 Straight-A Stocks to Build Your Portfolio     AroundMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Is Building an AI     MonsterThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings Previewappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 ETF Myths And 4 Trading Tips From The Man Who Helped Launch SPY;January 25
column4: beloved of so many investors in exchange traded funds
column5: like an   Apple (AAPL) iPhone? In both cases
column6: the teams who helped launch the products   did not anticipate they would revolutionize an industry.""When we designed SPY
column7: we had no idea how flexible the ETF   vehicle would turn out to be
column8: Jim Ross
column9: chairman of the global   SPDR business at State Street Global Advisors
column10: said Tuesday at   the 10th annual Inside ETFs conference in Hollywood
column11: Fla. ""We   could not have imagined all the innovative ways ETFs are being   used today.""Ross
column12: who was part of the team that launched SPY 24 years ago
column13: made that point as he drew a parallel between the iPhone's impact   on the technology industry and ETFs' transformation of the   investment landscape.makeArticleAd();As U.S. ETFs enter their 25th year
column14: the ETF industry is   cheering both the fact that this investment vehicle holds a total   of more than $2 trillion in assets and that ETFs represent less   than 5% of the investable market - meaning
column15: there's still plenty   of room to grow.ETFs certainly continue to be on a hot growth streak. ""ETF   assets have roughly doubled every three years over the past   decade
column16: Ross said at a conference session titled ""The ETF   Revolution And What's Next For ETFs."" He said that there is no   reason why global ETF assets cannot cross $16 trillion by 2025 at   the continued annual growth rate of 19%.Driving demand for
column17: and innovative use of
column18: ETFs are a host of   insurance companies
column19: ETF strategists
column20: sovereign wealth funds
column21: wealth management firms and even mutual funds
column22: he added.But Ross also pointed out that risks tied toETF   investinginclude a persistent lack of understanding about these   investment vehicles. In his afternoon address
column23: he sought to   debunk common myths about ETFs and offered some tips for trading   ETFs.Myth 1:""ETF liquidity (issues) could blow up the fixed-income   market."" Despite this common perception
column24: ETFs comprise less than   1% of the total fixed-income market
column25: Ross said. That makes it   unlikely they will ""blow up"" an entire market.In fact
column26: Ross believes fixed-income ETFs can be more efficient   than other fixed-income products
column27: as assets in them have   continued to increase to more than $400 billion today. And   although the underlying fixed-income market can be opaque
column28: fixed-income ETFs offer transparency in terms of trading costs   and portfolio holdings
column29: he added.Myth 2:""ETFs gone wild."" Referring to the belief that the   proliferation of ETFs can harm investors
column30: Ross said he believes   ETF issuers like his own company are diligent about making sure   new launches meet existing needs. Even a crudely constructed ETF
column31: he added
column32: displays the American value of ""take an idea to market   and test it out.""The lesson here
column33: Ross said
column34: is that ""all ETF investors need to   understand what they are buying
column35: when they are buying.""Myth 3:""ETFs fail to track intrinsic value in volatile markets.""   According to Ross
column36: ETFs have in some cases helped the process of   price discovery in challenging markets.""That happened on Aug. 24 (2015)
column37: he said. ""SPY traded   efficiently throughout the day"" despite the extreme volatility inthe stock marketthat day.Ross noted
column38: too
column39: that following that day's tradingdisruptions in some stocks and ETFs
column40: an ETF industry coalition took action to harmonize exchange   rules to address the issue.The lesson here
column41: Ross added
column42: is to understand ETF trading   basics:1. If you don't have to trade in volatile markets
column43: don't.2. Don't trade near the market open. Volatility tends to be   high as the markets price in the news.3. Use limit orders. These are generally seen to have   advantages over market orders in terms of price control and   protection.4. Reconsider the use of stop orders. As many ETF investors   unhappily discovered on Aug. 24
column44: stop orders become market orders   once the price is hit. And they run the risk of selling for much   below their intended price in serious market disruptions.A stop order is an order to buy or sell a stock once the price   of the stock reaches a specified price. A limit order is an order   to buy or sell a stock at a specified price or better.Introducing Ross to the audience
column45: Inside ETFs CEO Matt Hougan   made note of Ross' leadership role in the industry for more than   two decades.""There's a reason everyone loves him
column46: Hougan said. ""He's the   chairman of the ICI (Investment Company Institute) ETF committee.   He does education everywhere he can.""The Inside ETFs conferenceconcludes Wednesday.RELATED:The 'Trump ETFs' Spotlighted As 6 Best     Investment Ideas For 2017"

column1: Tech Stock Roundup: AAPL-QCOM Deal
column4: 04:17:00 PM EDT;"With the 45thPresident of the United States vowing to bring back jobs to the country
column5: teach China a lesson and institute large-scale tax reform
column6: there has been a great deal of uncertainty surrounding technology stocks. To make matters worse
column7: President Trump has an axe to grind with AmazonAMZNand AppleAAPLwhile most AlphabetGOOGLexecutives have openly supported the democrats going into the elections.So companies are now making nice with the President like Tesla's Elon Musk
column8: who has changed tunes and is now tweeting his support. It's been reported that Google's Schmidt has also found reasons to visit the President. Executives that have supported Trump from the start are better off: some speculate that Zuckerberg is considering politics while ex-MicrosoftMSFTand GM employee Chris Liddell is moving to the White House as assistant to the President and director of strategic initiatives. Oracle CEO Safra Catz joined the executive committee of Trump's presidential transition team in December.Then there's Cramer
column9: promising us that the post inauguration sell-off won't last and that it's actually an opportunity to buy stocks.Amidst all the excitement surrounding the swearing in
column10: the FTC sued QualcommQCOMfor anti-competitive practices while Mark Zuckerberg took the stand to defend Facebook'sFBpurchase of Oculus. So let's dig in.Apple Forced to Use Qualcomm ChipsFollowing similar lawsuits
column11: huge fines ($1 billion in China and $890 million in Korea) and anticompetitive investigations in Taiwan and the EU
column12: the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued Qualcomm for ""de facto exclusive deals that were as effective as express purchase requirements and that effectively foreclosed Qualcomm's competitors from gaining processor business at Apple.""The FTC alleges that Qualcomm allowed Apple billions in discounts for exclusively using its chips and not using the competing 4G Wi-Max standard that Intel was pushing. This agreement
column13: running from 2011 to 2016
column14: ultimately killed WiMax. Apple wasted no time in sourcing from Intel after the expiry of the agreement in Sep 2016.Another point in contention is Qualcomm's practice of limiting access to its cellular chips and then hiking royalty payments
column15: amounting to ""a tax on the manufacturers' use of baseband processors manufactured by Qualcomm's competitors."" The FTC filed the lawsuit after a 2-1 vote. Qualcomm has of course denied the charges while Apple chose not to comment.Following the FTC lawsuit
column16: Apple filed one of its own against Qualcomm for a billion dollars. The amount is what Apple alleges that Qualcomm is witholding for rebates. Like the FTC says
column17: the deal was to keep Qualcomm chips in Apple products and is a fair indication that Qualcomm finally has some real competition.Mark Zuckerberg TestifiesFacebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg took the stand last week to deny charges that Facebook was aware of the violation of any employee agreement between Occulus head John Carmack and its former employer id Software
column18: a unit of ZeniMax
column19: the plaintiff in this case. He also denied that the technology developed by the startup Occulus and its founder Palmer Luckey was based on copyrighted technology belonging to ZeniMax.Carmack previously testified that he copied files from ZeniMax before moving to Occulus but did not use the information in Occulus and the terms of his employment allowed him to get involved with Occulus even while in ZeniMax employ. But the thing that could cost Facebook at this point is ZeniMax lawyer Toni Sammi's question: ""So your plan for a $2-point-something billion deal was to begin legal diligence on Friday
column20: and sign the deal on Monday
column21: over a weekend
column22: right?"" to which Zuckerberg said
column23: ""Yeah.""CompanyLast WeekLast  6 MonthsAAPL+2.09%+21.62%FB+0.33%+6.42%YHOO-0.14%+10.80%GOOGL-0.16%+9.94%MSFT+0.21%+16.26%INTC+0.63%+5.38%CSCO+0.20%+0.64%AMZN-0.65%+9.82%Other stories you might have missed-CorporateIndia Considering Apple Case: It's hard to tell just how badly India wants Apple to manufacture in the country. But if government officials agree to Apple's demands
column24: it would indicate that they want it bad. Because Apple has asked for just about every concession possible
column25: ranging from reduction in import duties on smartphones
column26: customs duty exemption on manufacturing equipment and raw materials
column27: a ""less-intrusive"" customs procedure to be completed in 30 minutes
column28: the right to import and refurbish iPhones that are more than 3 years old so they can be exported
column29: and so forth.Apple is trying to convince government officials that Indian made iPhones won't be competitive unless they give in to these demands even as its manufacturing costs in China are on the rise. But Asian phone makers are already manufacturing in the country with no such concessions
column30: so the regulations themselves may need to be altered and relaxed to accommodate not just Apple but also other manufacturers. This could take time.On a positive note
column31: Reuters reports that Information Technology Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has mentioned the setting up of a government panel headed by the cabinet secretary that would now clear investment proposals in the electronics sector above $1 billion
column32: instead of them going through multiple government departments.Microsoft Executive Joins Baidu: Baidu has appointed Qi Lu as its Chief Operating Officer and Group Head as it turns focus to artificial intelligence as the next growth driver. The company was mixed up in a scandal involving medical ads that led to stricter government regulations and consequently hit its revenues.Lu left Microsoft last year on health concerns but was in charge of its search business and also part of the team involved in architecting its artificial intelligence and bots technology. He holds more than 40 U.S. patents.Google Ad Auctions Are Suspect: The Wall Street Journal has independently confirmed that ads for Google products and the products of its sister companies usually find the top spot on the search engine results page. On checking 25K search results
column33: it found that Google products occupied the top spot 91% of the time and the top two spots 43% of the time.Google has said that this is because it is also a buyer of ads
column34: so its position comes from paying a higher price. It also says that this doesn't raise prices because when others bid for the price
column35: it's as if Google isn't bidding. Bottom line: other advertisers lose the top spot no matter what they bid for it. Google reportedly removed its ads in a number of cases when confronted with the data last December.Amazon
column36: Apple End Audiobook Exclusivity Deal: Apple and Amazon have decided to end the deal initiated back in 2008
column37: according to which Amazon subsidiary Audible became the exclusive supplier of audiobooks to Apple and was barred from selling to any other party. The agreement was actually serving no one because the market for audiobooks has advanced since then and it's now in the interest of both parties to be able to source from others and in Audible's case
column38: to also be able to sell on other platforms. Nonetheless
column39: it was preceded by regulatory scrutiny of the deal by German and EU competition authorities that felt it was inflating prices.Pandora Shares Gain: Pandora preannounced fourth-quarter results that it said exceeded its revenue and EBITDA targets. This came as a relief because it has been lowering expectations the last two quarters indicating continuing bad news. Moreover
column40: Pandora also said that the $5-a-month Pandora Plus garnered 365K new subscribers in the quarter and the Pandora Premium service remained on track to launch later this quarter. It also expects to lay off around 7% of the U.S. workforce
column41: which will further boost margins.Legal/RegulatoryCisco-Arista Developments: The U.S. Customs and Border Patrol agency has expressed concern that its earlier decision to lift the ban on Arista switches may have been incorrect. Following conversations with CiscoCSCO
column42: the CBP therefore intends to reinstate the ban. Arista has said that it will respond to Cisco points and re-engage with the CBP.In the meantime
column43: U.S.-manufactured switches will have to make do
column44: which can result in supply glitches and pressure on its gross margin. On Dec 2
column45: the ITC judge ruled that Arista patents infringe on Cisco's and Arista has subsequently produced workaround while denying the charges. A full commission review of the judge's decision will be completed by Apr 9.New Technology/ProductsGoogle to Launch Android One Phones In U.S.: Google's high-end Pixel phones are mostly unavailable
column46: but it's already gearing up to launch the low-end ($200-$300) Android One devices in the country by the middle of the year. The goal seems to be to build brand value and familiarize people with the Android ecosystem.Android One was first launched in India and later in other countries including Japan and then Europe. It is a system under which Google agrees beforehand with handset manufacturers to push out Android updates as soon as they are available so the experience is true to the latest iteration of the software.M&A and CollaborationsHPE Buying Simplivity: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is dishing out $650 million to buy SimpliVity
column47: the second largest provider of hyperconvergence software (after Nutanix which has over 50% market share). The company describes a hyperconverged system as one that integrates compute
column48: storage and networking into a pre-configured system
column49: managed by a user-friendly software platform that doesn't require extensive IT staff for set up and management.Within a couple of months after the deal closes
column50: HPE will offer a range of integrated HPE SimpliVity hyperconverged systems based on HPE ProLiant Servers. The acquisition significantly strengthens its position in the space where competitors like Cisco and Dell/EMC base their hyperconvergence solutions on market leader Nutanix or Simplivity software. HPE will initially support current SimpliVity customers.Cisco
column51: Ericsson Join Forces in Australia: The collaboration between Ericsson and Cisco on telecom cloud infrastructure has yielded a major customer in Vodafone Hutchison Australia (VHA). The companies will virtualize Vodafone's infrastructure
column52: enabling it to improve customer service and user experience while increasing network agility
column53: reducing opex and capex
column54: and speeding up the deployment of services. The partnership has reportedly generated 60 new deals and is expected to generate revenue of a billion dollars to each partner by 2018.Microsoft Acquires Simplygon: Microsoft has acquired 3D data optimization specialist Simplygon of Sweden for an undisclosed sum. This is intended to play an important role in developing its 3D For Everyone strategy
column55: which is part of the Windows 10 Creators Update. 3D optimization is used by game developers and others to facilitate 3D content creation.Simplygon also does more than this: it has already started optimizing content for AR and VR technology
column56: including for Microsoft's Hololens. Microsoft believes that by making the technology a part of its creators update
column57: users will be empowered to capture
column58: create and share 3D content thus augmenting their productivity
column59: collaboration and creativity.Google Buys Twitter Developers Platform: Google has acquired Fabric
column60: which is based on Crashlytics technology (crash analytics
column61: app feedback and real-time analytics) that Twitter acquired back in 2013. Google hasn't said how much it's paying for Fabric
column62: but has said that it will be a part of its cloud based mobile software effort called Firebase that was itself acquired in 2014. Firebase offers mobile app developers tools to build and monitor their apps
column63: so any attempt to build its capabilities should help the company attract developers.Alibaba Has Long-term Digital Deal: Alibaba and the International Olympic Committee (IOC) signed a deal
column64: according to which Alibaba will be responsible for the IOC's digital presence through its cloud platform. The deal makes Alibaba the digital sponsor of the Olympics in cloud services
column65: e-commerce and television for a period running through 2028. While immediate returns may not there
column66: this lends credibility to the service and should help Alibaba win big customer accounts.WDC Considering Toshiba Stake: Nikkei Asian Review has reported that Toshiba is looking to spin off or sell off a 20% stake in its chip business in which case Western Digital might be the one picking it up. Toshiba is in trouble right now as it has to deal with an unprofitable nuclear business and accounting scandal that requires it to cough up some cash. Selling off a share to its longtime partner Western Digital (the two operate a flash memory fab in Japan) might be just the answer it needs.Some NumbersUK App Store Prices Up: As a result of the pound's continued declines
column67: Apple has been compelled to raise App store prices by as much as 25%.Intel Invests in Retail Tech: At the National Retail Federation's annual conference in New York
column68: Intel said that it intended to invest $100 million in retail technology over the next five years. It also announced the Intel Responsive Retail Platform
column69: which uses a combination of sensors
column70: software kits and other hardware solutions to provide ""in-the-moment information about what customers are buying
column71: what they want and how to manage inventory so it arrives just in time for customers to take it home"".Companies That Reported Results Last Week: CHKP

column73: PLXS

column1: Qualcomm Messed With the Wrong Customer;January 25
column3: 03:41:00 PM EDT;"Image source: Apple.""Let me get this straight. You think that your client
column4: one     of the wealthiest
column5: most powerful men in the world
column6: is secretly     a vigilante who spends his nights beating criminals to a pulp     with his bare hands. And your plan is to blackmail this     person?""makeArticleAd();-- Lucius Fox
column7: The Dark KnightIn Christopher Nolan'sThe Dark Knight(2008)
column8: an accountant discovers Batman's true identity by   uncovering some accounting irregularities at Wayne Enterprises
column9: but imaginary CEO Lucius Fox quickly puts an end to the   blackmailer's plan by pointing out how absurd it is.Qualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM) may not have been blackmailingApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) all these years
column10: but Apple thinks Qualcomm is   guilty of a similar crime: extortion. In itsU.S. lawsuitfiled last week
column11: Apple alleges that Qualcomm ""attempted to extort   Apple"" into changing how it responded to a regulatory antitrust   investigation in South Korea. The iPhone maker also argues that   it has been paying ""extortion-level royalties"" for years
column12: due to   Qualcomm's ""no license
column13: no chips"" policy where Qualcomm would only sell chips to customers that   agreed to onerous licensing terms.It seems as if Qualcomm has been getting away with this for   years
column14: which is why its market power has grown so dramatically as   rivals fell by the wayside and exited the baseband processor   market. Most customers lack the operating scale
column15: legal resources
column16: and financial incentive to effectively stand up to Qualcomm   through protracted litigation. Apple doesn't.Apple bites backSo let me get this straight
column17: Qualcomm: You think that your   biggest customer
column18: one of the wealthiest
column19: most powerful   corporations in the world that also has a reputation forsqueezing its supplierswould quietly accept your oppressive contract terms and   never fight back. And your plan is to extort this company?In no uncertain terms
column20: it worked for many years
column21: and   Qualcomm's revenue skyrocketed over the past decade.QCOM Revenue (Quarterly)data byYCharts.Broader smartphone adoption was the main factor
column22: but the   iPhone pulled an awful lot of that weight
column23: too -- both directly   and indirectly (Android was created largely in response to the   iPhone). More specifically
column24: from 2011 to late 2016
column25: Qualcomm had   extracted both exclusivity in supplying Apple with cellular   baseband modems as well as its silence. You may note in the chart   above how much sales increased during this time period. Apple was   restricted from actively complaining to law enforcement and   regulators
column26: although it was allowed to respond if asked. So long   as Qualcomm maintained its lock on baseband chipsets
column27: it had   incredible leverage and there wasn't a whole lot Apple could   do.EnterIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) . Intel had been trying to crack the baseband   market for years with little to no success. Even today
column28: Intel's   modems are technologically inferior to Qualcomm's
column29: but they're   good enough and much cheaper
column30: and Intel expects to catch up   within a few generations. The combination of Qualcomm's   exclusivity ending combined with Intel's ability to supply a   sufficiently competitive modem is the perfect storm for Apple to   unleash its pent-up discontent in court. The $1 billion that   Qualcomm is withholding was just the final straw.Now that Apple has a path to an alternative supplier (even   though the majority of its basebands still come from Qualcomm)   and is no longer contractually obligated to keep quiet
column31: Apple is   bringing a brutal suit against Qualcomm thatthreatens Qualcomm's very business model. You know it's serious when Apple is litigating
column32: givenCEO Tim Cook's hatred of litigation. Did Qualcomm really think that Apple would never retaliate?The moral of the story: Don't extort Apple
column33: and don't   blackmail Batman.10 stocks we like better than QualcommWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Intel Corporation Thinks It Can Catch Up to Qualcomm
column4: 02:58:00 PM EDT;"The launch of theApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) iPhone 7-series smartphones market what was
column5: arguably
column6: the most significant design win that microprocessor   giantIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) had ever scored in smartphones.Image source: Intel.makeArticleAd();A large portion of Apple's iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus   smartphones include Intel's XMM 7360 cellular modem
column7: and the   chipmaker seems to be working hard to ensure that it builds   compelling enough products to continue to win future iPhone   business.At a recent investor conference
column8: the head of Intel's Client   Computing Group
column9: Navin Shenoy
column10: spent some time talking about the   company's investments in and strategies related to cellular   modems. In this column
column11: I'd like to go over the salient points of   that discussion.A ""strategic investment""Shenoy began by saying that cellular modems represent a   ""strategic investment"" for the chipmaker.""We do think that as the world gets more smart and connected
column12: you're going to need modems -- it's going to be a core   intellectual property
column13: much like graphics was 10 years
column14: 15 years   ago
column15: for Intel
column16: he explained.Autonomous vehicles stand to benefit from cellular   connectivity. Image source: Intel.Shenoy went on to say that modems are going to be important in   many of the key areas that Intel wants to participate in
column17: including personal computers
column18: cars
column19: smartphones
column20: and ""other   [Internet of things] applications.""One modem a year keeps Apple interestedThe executive reiterated a commitment that other Intel   executives have made in the past -- Intel intends to release new   cellular modems each year. He also said that the company's next   generation cellular modem
column21: branded the XMM 7480
column22: is scheduled to   go into ""high-volume manufacturing"" during 2017. The 7360 entered   mass production in 2016.Image source: Apple.Considering that Apple is pretty much the only major buyer of   Intel's cellular modems
column23: it's clear that Intel is aiming to   deliver new modems on this schedule so that its chips are ready   to go for when Apple launches new smartphones each fall.Modem manufacturing strategyIt's well known that all the modems that Intel has released   thus far haven't been manufactured by Intel -- they're designed   by Intel and manufactured by third parties.Shenoy declined to comment on where Intel will be   manufacturing the next-generation XMM 7480 -- or
column24: as he was quick   to point out
column25: future modems -- but made it clear that Intel's   manufacturing choices would be made on a ""pragmatic basis"" and   that the company is evaluating both in-house manufacturing as   well as external options for future modems.Catching up with the market leaderQualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM) is known for being the leading manufacturer of   cellular modems
column26: but Shenoy did take the opportunity to brag a   little bit about the company's recently announced 5G modem
column27: referring to it as the ""world's first global 5G modem.""Image source: Qualcomm.""All I can tell you is the investment in the modem portfolio   -- and the commitment to invest in the modem portfolio -- is very   strong and we think that over time we can be in an absolute   equivalent position to our competitors
column28: Shenoy asserted.The executive conceded that the company is ""coming from a   position of being behind and so it's going to take us a few   generations to catch up.""Catching up with the market leaders
column29: particularly Qualcomm
column30: is   going to be a tall order
column31: but if the company can pull it off
column32: I'm   sure that Apple -- which likes to have multiple sources for   critical components -- will be extremely happy.10 stocks we like better than QualcommWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column34: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade

column1: Apple
column2: Inc. Brings Its Fight With Qualcomm to China;January 25
column4: 02:30:00 PM EDT;"Image source: Apple.Earlier this month
column5: Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) filed ablockbuster lawsuitagainst its most important supplier
column6: Qualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM)
column7: alleging a wide range of transgressions that   were all intended to enhance Qualcomm's monopoly power over the   baseband processor market. That suit came just days after theU.S. Federal Trade Commission fileda similar regulatory antitrust complaint against the mobile chip   giant.makeArticleAd();Apple isn't stopping there; the Mac maker is now taking its   grievances to the Middle Kingdom.There's more where that came fromApple has filed not one
column8: but two suits against Qualcomm in   Beijing
column9: Reutersreports. The first is seeking 1 billion yuan (approximately $145   million) in damages
column10: accusing Qualcomm of abusing its monopoly   power in the baseband market. The second alleges that Qualcomm   has not fulfilled its obligations to license its   standards-essential patents under fair
column11: reasonable
column12: and   non-discriminatory (FRAND) levels.The fact that Apple is suing Qualcomm in China is notable for   a few reasons
column13: the most obvious being that the scope of Apple's   complaints reaches beyond just the U.S. itself. Apple's lawsuit   in the U.S. was filed in the U.S. District Court of Southern   California. China also doesn't have a particularly good   reputation for enforcing intellectual property (IP) laws
column14: although the country has been making progress on improving its   legal frameworks. The discrepancy in IP enforcement is one reason   why many Chinese smartphone manufacturers
column15: most notably Xiaomi
column16: are unable to expand operations into countries with stricter   enforcement.China is also where the vast majority of Apple's contract   manufacturers are located
column17: including its most prolific iPhone   assembler
column18: Foxconn. These contract manufacturers are partially   responsible for Apple's predicament with Qualcomm. As noted inApple's U.S. complaint
column19: Qualcomm refuses to license its IP directly to Apple
column20: instead   preferring to ink deals with Apple contract manufacturers that   pass along both the IP rights indirectly as well as the royalty   costs in full. Apple's manufacturing partners simply accept   Qualcomm's terms and do not negotiate
column21: leaving Apple with massive   royalty bills.Apple has long attempted to review the agreements between   Qualcomm and its contract manufacturers
column22: but Qualcomm must   consent -- and it won't. I'm neither an American or Chinese   lawyer
column23: but it seems possible that Apple is seeking legal   assistance in China so that it may gain access or somehow   restructure these agreements
column24: although legal discovery in China   is significantly more restricted than here in the U.S. Even if   that's not the goal
column25: it wouldn't hurt to collect more in monetary   damages by filing suit in multiple relevant jurisdictions
column26: as   Apple says it's been overcharged by billions of dollars over the   past five years.This serves as additional evidence that Apple has absolutelyno intention of settlingwith Qualcomm. The company feels as if it has been wronged all   these years
column27: being coerced into quietly overpaying Qualcomm for   half a decade. And now that Qualcomm's exclusivity has ended
column28: the   time for reckoning has come.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Starbucks Corporation (SBUX) Stock Hinges on Same-Store Sales Numbers;January 25
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt's no secret that the retail sector and restaurant stocks are both suffering. Living in the world between the two
column5: venerable slinger of legal stimulantsStarbucks Corporation(NASDAQ:SBUX) is caught in the crosshairs of lower consumer spending. With its focus on both beverages and gifts
column6: its earnings report is a critical one for SBUX. Even more so
column7: since it has now started to refrain from providing forward guidance figures.Source:Javier Gonzlez Via FlickrThe name of the game for SBUX will be same-store sales and whether or not its loyalty program is indeed paying benefits in the consumer slowdown.makeArticleAd();For investors
column8: this Starbucks earnings report is very much one to watch.A Focus on Consumer Growth at SBUXThe so-called restaurant recession has even started to have its way with mighty Starbucks. Over the last few quarters
column9: SBUX has seen its global traffic start to slip. Much of that slippage has come from the United States. Just askMcDonald's Corporation(NYSE:MCD) about its recent numbers coming from the U.S. The restaurant recession is real
column10: and consumers are clamping down on the amount they are spending out to eat.SBUX was considered more immune to the effects
column11: but it looks like the coffee purveyor could get hit by the slowdown after all.10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW     Still BargainsDuring thepreviously reported quarter
column12: SBUX posted just a 1% increase in global consumer traffic for the last 12 months. During the prior quarter
column13: Starbucks posted a 3% jump. Just in the U.S.
column14: Starbucks actually reported a 1%declinein traffic. This dwindling of traffic resulted in same-store sales growth dropping to just a 5% increase vs. a 6% in each of the previous four fiscal years.That drop can be a tad bit worrisome for SBUX stock owners. And considering that it has proved no guidance on what to expect
column15: analysts don't exactly agree on what the jump - if any - will be.But one thing they all agree on is that its revamped loyalty program and recent tech initiatives will be its saving grace.SBUX changed the way it calculated rewards and free drinks a few quarters ago. The new system is proving to be a huge win for consumers and Starbucks itself.This ""digital ecosystem"" that links Starbucks Cards
column16: apps
column17: and various corporate partnerships with companies such asApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) and theNew York Times Co(NYSE:NYT) is continuing to drive sales at the firm and overcome potentially worse dips. Last quarter
column18: payment via mobile means represented 6% of their total and saw a big increase. Traditional Starbucks card orders/payments also rose considerably.With new plug-ins for its mobile app/loyalty rewards members
column19: the hope is that SBUX stock can turn around the recent drop in sales/foot traffic.Other efforts such as its continued focus on food should also help. SBUX is quickly turning into a lunch and mid-day destination
column20: rather than just a place to get your morning cup of joe. However
column21: even here
column22: it has seen some adverse effects.Its recent stoppageof late-night beer and wine sales highlights the challenging restaurant environment.Even with the declines
column23: it is still expected to see a rise in total revenues for the quarter.According to FactSet
column24: Starbucks is expected to report earnings per share of 52 cents. That's up from up from 46 cents reported for the same period last year. Revenues should clock in at $5.85 billion - up from $5.37 billion last year.In the end
column25: the focus will be 100% on the trend/pace of sales and store foot traffic. Investors will be looking to see if SBUX can stop the bleeding of foot traffic and reverse the trend.SBUX Still a Profit MachineFor SBUX
column26: the tale isn't about profits. It has those. The focus will come down to whether or not the giant can really overcome the new operating environment that all eateries and retailers are facing. It's tough out there - the recent decline in same-store sales highlight justhowtough.Intel Corporation (INTC) Q4 Earnings     PreviewHowever
column27: don't forget that SBUX has more arrows in its quiver than the average retailer/restaurant stock.This quarter will be all about how it uses those arrows and whether it can hit the bullseye. If it falters even a tad
column28: investors could sell down SBUX shares.As of this writing
column29: Aaron Levitt did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Straight-A Stocks to Build Your Portfolio     AroundThe 7 Best High-Yield Investments for     RetirementThe postStarbucks Corporation (SBUX) Stock Hinges on Same-Store Sales Numbersappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Your iPhone Already Uses Artificial Intelligence
column4: 02:19:00 PM EDT;"We were all fascinated by Siri when she first burst onto the   scene five years ago. The world was captivated
column5: the talking   computer hadfinallyarrived and was easily available. Since then
column6: more fascinating   examples of artificial intelligence (AI) have emerged. Siri is so   2011.While other tech companies have been introducingflashy new examplesof AI at play
column7: it appeared thatApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) had lost its advantage and was falling behind in   the pursuit of this nascent technology. While some thought Apple   had languished
column8: it turns out it has been quietly integrating AI   into many everyday features of its iconic iPhone. More   importantly
column9: Apple says it's doing so while protecting your   privacy.makeArticleAd();Apple has been quietly upgrading Siri using artificial   intelligence. Image source: Pixabay.There's more going on under the hoodSiri got its first major overhaul in mid-2014 when its voice   recognition was shifted to a neural network. This AI model
column10: designed to simulate the human brain
column11: is a combination of   software and algorithms that improves over time by learning from   its experience. This was the first of many such upgrades to Siri
column12: all without much fanfare.Apple has been using AI to improve a number of its native   apps. The Maps app will automatically identify traffic problems   and route you around them. It will also help you find your car in   the parking lot. The Photos app will identify the people in your   photos and can group them together. The Memories app will collect   images from your phone to create an event video
column13: memorializing a   recent outing or vacation. iMessage will automatically translate   text to emojis.Siri can interact with third-party apps to order pizza
column14: schedule an Uber or Lyft
column15: or start a workout. It will integrate   with other popular apps such as WhatsApp
column16: Skype
column17: WeChat
column18: and   Pinterest.Apple isn't stopping there. Siri is available on Apple Watches   and TVs
column19: and with the macOS Sierra update
column20: it will even work   on laptops and Macintosh computers. It will now search for   documents on your computer and narrow those searches even further   using keywords.Better selfies and a secret...Improved images using AI technology. Image source:     Apple.Apple used AI to strengthen the capabilities of the camera on   its iPhone 7. It claims this is not only the best camera in any   smartphone
column21: but thanks to the company's software
column22: the iPhone 7   can produce images that once required an expensive camera and   professional photographer. Using AI and algorithms
column23: it can   distinguish between the subject of the photo and the background
column24: which simply wasn't possible with previous smartphone cameras due   to the size of the aperture. This latest upgrade can also   determine depth with the introduction of two lenses.There is intriguing evidence that more powerful AI may be   coming with the recent discovery ofa specialized chipwithin the iPhone. Thefield-programmable gate array processor   inside the latest iPhone can be re-purposed after installation
column25: and has historically been used to accelerate machine learning.   Apple has repeatedly said that it would protect user privacy
column26: and   does so by keeping the most sensitive user data stored locally on   the device. This latest revelation would be in keeping with that   philosophy by enabling more sophisticated machine learning   capabilities directly on the phone.While other companies are uploading data to the cloud to   achieve advances in AI
column27: Apple says it can make the same gains
column28: all while protecting your privacy. It's tapping the concept of   differential privacy
column29: which seeks to identify trends without   sacrificing personal data. In this technology
column30: electronic ""noise""   is added to information on the phone
column31: protecting the raw data and   transmitting only the trends. This approach keeps user data at   the local phone level while allowing Apple to continue its   advances in AI.In a recent interview
column32: Tim Cook said:Look at the (technologies) that will be dominant in     smartphones of the future -- like AI. AI will make this product     even more essential to you. It will become even a better     assistant than it is today. So where you probably aren't     leaving home without it today -- you're really going to be     connected to it in the future...we do all of that while     protecting your privacy. Instead of passing all that     information to the cloud
column33: where we're maintaining it all
column34: we do     a lot of it on the device itself. So you're in control of your     own data.Foolish final wordAs the use of AI becomes more prolific
column35: justifiable concerns     regarding protecting individual information may become more     prevalent. If Apple succeeds in gathering the data it needs     while still protecting the data of its users
column36: this may force     other companies to follow suit. Apple has always demonstrated a     concern for protecting customer data. In a recent extreme     example
column37: it stood against the FBI in early 2016
column38: rejecting a     request to unlock the iPhone of the terrorist behind theSan     Bernardino mass shooting
column39: citing privacy concerns.Putting user privacy first gives Apple a continuing     competitive advantage
column40: even as other companies garner headlines     around their AI breakthroughs.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock       tip

column4: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is news of flexible iPhone displays. Today
column5: we'll look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor Wednesday.Flexible Displays:Japan Display Inc.is working on flexible LCD screens
column6: reportsThe Wall Street Journal. Japan Display
column7: a supplier of parts for Apple devices
column8: says   that it plans to reduce the costs of making the flexible   displays. It also claims that some smartphone makers are   interested in using the displays in the next few years. However
column9: it wouldn't put a name to these smartphone makers. The company   says it plans to start mass production in 2018. It notes that   this is the result of demand from its buyers.makeArticleAd();Theater Mode:The Apple Watch will be getting a Theater Mode in   the first watchOS 3.2 beta
column10: MacRumorsnotes. The beta hasn't been released yet
column11: but AAPL has released   the notes for it. This is where the Theater Mode feature is   mentioned. It will allow owners to quickly change the device's   settings so that it doesn't make sound during movies. It will   also turn off the raise to wake feature that has the display   turning on when movement is detected.Battery Glitch:Owners of iPhone devices affected by the 30%   battery glitch didn't see a fix with iOS 10.2.1
column12: reportsBGR. This glitch can cause older iPhone devices to shut off when   they reach 30% of battery life remaining. AAPL is aware of the   problem and has offered a replacement program for certain devices   affected by it. However
column13: it doesn't extend to all devices that   are reportedly affected by the glitch. The tech company   previously said a software update may fix the issue
column14: but iOS 2.1   doesn't solve it.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postWednesday Apple Rumors: AAPL May Use Flexible   Displays in Future iPhonesappeared first onInvestorPlace."
