column1: Is Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Ending the Age of Intel (INTC)?;January 25
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFor decades
column5: Intel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) was at the heart of the technology industry. As the company whose CPUs dominated the PC era
column6: it was second to none. But Intel missed out on the mobile revolution and with PCs losing relevance every year
column7: its leadership position has weakened. Nudging itself into Intel's place?NvidiaCorporation(NASDAQ:NVDA).makeArticleAd();Click to EnlargeSource: NVIDIANvidia started as a PC graphics card manufacturer
column8: but now
column9: NVDA stock is riding a wave of virtual reality gaming
column10: artificial intelligence
column11: deep data analysis
column12: cloud computing and self-driving cars.As its GPU-accelerated products take over processor-intensive computing
column13: is Nvidia set to dethrone Intel?GPUs Make the Leap From Graphics to Raw Processing PowerIn the old days of computing
column14: graphics processing units (GPUs) played second fiddle to central processing units (CPUs).Intel's processors were literally at the heart of almost every computer sold. The CPU was responsible for running the computer
column15: including its operating system. When a GPU was installed
column16: the CPU was still primary
column17: but it farmed off graphics-intensive tasks to the GPU. Most PCs used integrated graphics that were built into their Intel CPU. Graphics cards from companies like Nvidia - with a standalone GPU - were primarily used in specialized gaming PCs.It helps to think of the CPU as a generalist
column18: while the GPU does one thing over and over. This difference began really turning to the advantage of NVDA about a decade ago.10 Companies That Are Bringing Jobs Back to AmericaDesktop PC CPUs from Intel might have four cores
column19: letting the CPU manage a handful of different tasks simultaneously. GPUs were equipped with hundreds of cores
column20: and software developers realized they could take advantage of this raw parallel processing power for much more than just graphics. The GPU could be used to greatly accelerate software performance when repetitive tasks are being performed - encoding video
column21: for example
column22: or data analysis.GPU acceleration can make some tasks 100 times fasterthan a CPU alone.Because the GPU is designed for one primary purpose - everything including computer graphics boils down to crunching numbers - NVDA is able to produce them at far lower cost than a CPU at an equivalent performance level
column23: while producing less heat and using less power.Why GPUs Are in Higher Demand Than CPUsWhy the demand for GPUs?Think of how the demand for processor-intensive computing power has increased over the past decade. One early example was Bitcoin. The virtual currency could be purchased
column24: but it could also be ""mined"" by using a PC to run a complex algorithm in search of Bitcoins. Miners soon discovered that a GPU - with its parallel number-crunching capability - was far more effective than a CPU at mining Bitcoins.Anywhere from 50 to 100 times faster. Soon miners were running rigs consisting of multiple GPUs connected together.Meantime
column25: GPUs have rapidly become more powerful
column26: with more cores and faster clock rates
column27: even as CPU development has become relatively incremental.Intel's new seventh-generation Kaby Lake Core i7 CPU for desktop computers still has four cores. In comparison
column28: Nvidia's latestTitan X graphics cardhas 3
column29: 584 processing cores on tap. The Intel CPU costs less than a third of the Titan X's $1200 MSRP
column30: but when used in number-crunching applications
column31: the Nvidia card's price is a steal.The technology that has the big potential for future growth involvesextremenumber crunching. Think virtual reality
column32: the hottest trend in gaming. Cloud services - which are often a single
column33: processor-intensive task like image recognition offloaded to the web. Artificial intelligence
column34: machine learning
column35: data mining and deep data - these all require incredible processing power. Computers running INTC CPUs are too expensive and too general purpose to be running these tasks. Instead
column36: you're more likely to find server farms powered by GPUs.NVDA has also integrated its powerful GPUs into the forefront of one of the technology holy grails: self-driving cars.Nvidia Drive PX2is the company's AI car computing platform. With two GPUs providing the horsepower
column37: NVDA says it is capable of 34 trillion deep learning operations per second. Additional units can be run in parallel for fully autonomous driving. Nvidia has alreadypartnered with multiple high-profile automakersto equip their self-driving cars with its technology
column38: includingBMW
column39: VolvoandTesla Motors Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA)Growing Importance of the GPU Reflected in NVDA StockYou can track the relative trajectories in INTC and NVDA by comparing their stock prices. Over the past five years
column40: Intel has grown in value by a little more than 40%. That's not bad
column41: but doesn't look quite so good when you compare it to the height of PC popularity. Since 2000
column42: when PC sales were notching14.5% annual sales growth
column43: Intel stock has actually dropped by 10%.3 Internet of Things (IoT) Stocks to Buy Now (NVDA
column44: ISIL
column45: STM)In comparison
column46: Nvidia stock is up by a whopping 650% in the past five years
column47: and nearly 2
column48: 600% since 2000.Intel Isn't Going Anywhere
column49: But the Age of NVIDIA Has ArrivedComputer sales continue their slow slide
column50: down another 5.7% in 2016. Much of Intel's revenue is tied to the PC market. Nvidia is not immune to the effect of declining PC sales
column51: either.But while INTC is trying to tie its future to technology like the Internet of Things (which is struggling with security issues and competing standards)
column52: NVDA has leveraged the massive parallel processing power of its GPUs to be a leader in multiple cutting-edge areas like AI
column53: deep data
column54: virtual reality and autonomous vehicles.Increasingly
column55: it's looking like we're entering the age of Nvidia. NVDA stock reflects that reality.As of this writing
column56: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy"" 20173 Things Apple Inc. (AAPL) MUST Do to Soar in 201710 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW Still BargainsThe postIs Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Ending the Age of Intel (INTC)?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

And thatbodes wellfor MSFT stock.The Nadella EffectNew CEO Satya Nadella deserves much of the credit for the turnaround in Microsoft and MSFT stock. Since Nadella was was appointed as CEO on Feb. 4

With growth opportunities emerging in the realm of Internet of Things

column1: Why Apple Inc. Stock (AAPL) Was Downgraded Ahead Of Earnings;January 25
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(AAPL) stock was little changed in early trading on Tuesday before rallying in Wednesday morning trading following a rare downgrade from analysts atBarclays.makeArticleAd();The iPhone maker is scheduled to release its next earnings report on Jan. 31
column5: and the story on Wall Street is weak iPhone 7 sales.Still
column6: some are finding cause to remain positive as consumers seem to be favoring the more expensive iPhone 7 Plus
column7: which of course is a good thing for the average selling price. Barclays' downgrade follows aprice target increaselast week.Apple Stock DowngradedIn a research note Tuesday morning
column8: Barclays analyst Mark Moskowitz went so far as to say that he doesn't see any big catalysts for Apple stock for the next 12 months. This implies that he's not even sure that the iPhone 8 will move the needle on sales enough to boost investor confidence
column9: at least in the early days. Twelve months will bring us past the launch of this year's iPhone models.The analyst downgraded Apple stock from ""Overweight""to ""Equal-weight""and trimmed his price target by $2 to $117 per share.Part of Moskowitz's newfound bearishness on Apple stock is less company-specific and more about the decelerating smartphone sales being felt across the industry.10 Stocks to Buy for Donald Trump's Second WindLooking out to the long term
column10: however
column11: he feels that the stickiness of the iPhone maker's ecosystem
column12: big cash stash and tenth anniversary iPhone (widely expected to bethe iPhone 8) will serve as a support for investors.Here's how two additional analysts view the future prospects for AAPL stockBuy AAPL On a PullbackPacific Crestanalyst Andy Hargreaves said on Monday that investors should think about buying Apple stock on a ""meaningful pullback."" Although he thinks December quarter sales might be in line with consensus
column13: he warned that March quarter sales could decline on the back of the iPhone's weakest sell-through data ever.However
column14: he maintained his ""Overweight""rating and $127 price target on Apple stock.UBSanalyst Steven Milunovich also has $127 price target paired with a Buy rating on Apple stock
column15: and he said in a note dated Jan. 24 that the CIRP survey suggests a mix shift toward the iPhone 7 Plus and models with more storage in the U.S.
column16: both of which are good for the average selling price.The survey indicated that 42% of iPhone sales were the Plus models
column17: a much greater percentage than last year's 26%. Sixty-two percent of buyers favored the $100 or $200 step-ups in storage
column18: and Android switchers remained stable even as the upgrade rate was strong.Milunovich is concerned about China and currency headwinds even though he still looks for iPhone growth in the double digits for fiscal 2018. He expects continued declines in China.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Q4 Earnings PreviewFurther
column19: the higher bill of materials for the iPhone 7 lineup could offset the mix shift toward more expensive models
column20: pressuring the gross margin.The UBS analyst is roughly in line with consensus on Apple'sDecember quarter earnings. He's looking for $77.8 billion in sales
column21: compared to the consensus of $77.4 billion and toward the high end of the company's outlook of $76 billion to 78 billion.He pegs the iPhone maker's earnings per share at $3.24 and its iPhone units at 76 million
column22: compared to the Street's estimate of 78 million. He estimates an average selling price of $693
column23: compared to the consensus of $685.The postApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Downgraded Ahead Of Earnings For Weak iPhone 7 Salesappeared first onValueWalk.Many academics claim investing is a ""random walk."" We believe this to be only partially true. It is our core belief that value investing can outperform the market
column24: hence the name ""ValueWalk."" Stock (AAPL) Was Downgraded Ahead Of Earningsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Alternative Facts? Apple
column4: 10:40:00 AM EDT;"Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) shares sat out of the stock market rally on   Tuesday
column5: largely because of a downgrade fromBarclays. Analyst Mark Moskowitz expects the smartphone market to   stagnate this year. Moreover
column6: unlike many other analysts
column7: he   doesn't see the upcoming 10th anniversary iPhone as a major   growth catalyst.Indeed
column8: Moskowitz asserts that iPhone buyers are increasingly   opting to buy older models like the iPhone 6s in order to save   $100
column9: rather than paying up for Apple's latest and greatest   designs. If consumers are becoming more focused on price than   design
column10: they might not care that much about the major design   changes expected in the next-generation iPhone.makeArticleAd();Are consumers still willing to pay up for the priciest iPhones   or are they trading down? Image source: Apple.However
column11: there is very little evidence that iPhone buyers are   actually trading down. As a result
column12: investors shouldn't pay much   attention to Moskowitz's bearish prognostications.Customers haven't been trading downiPhone users weren't trading down in a meaningful way during   the first half of fiscal 2016. In Q1 -- the all-important holiday   quarter -- Apple's average selling price (ASP) for the iPhone   rose slightly year over year
column13: despite a 6% to 7% headwind from   the strengthening dollar. The increase in ASPs was boosted by a   growing preference for pricier iPhones with larger screens and   more storage. Still
column14: the data aren't consistent with a big shift   toward buying older models.During Q2
column15: the iPhone ASP slipped about 2.5% year over year
column16: but it still likely rose on a currency-neutral basis.   Furthermore
column17: Apple faced a tough comparison that quarter because   it had been catching up from an iPhone 6 Plus supply shortage a   year earlier.The iPhone 6s sold quite well considering that it was only a     minor upgrade of the iPhone 6. Image source: Apple.The iPhone ASP did fall 10% and 8% on a year-over-year basis   in the third and fourth quarters
column18: respectively. That provides   some evidence of customers trading down. However
column19: much of the   decline was again caused by the strong dollar. Furthermore
column20: the   budget-priced iPhone SE launched early in Q3 last year. Thus
column21: for   most of the second half of fiscal 2016
column22: Apple's newest iPhone was   also its cheapest iPhone. This obviously weighed on ASPs.iPhone unit sales did decline last year
column23: perhaps due to   perceptions that the iPhone 6s wasn't a big upgrade over the   iPhone 6. Nevertheless
column24: considering all of the evidence
column25: it   appears that those consumers who did buy an iPhone during Apple's   fiscal 2016 continued to favor the newest models.Apple's iPhone mix probably improved last quarterWe won't know for sure whether the iPhone ASP increased or   decreased last quarter until Apple reports its Q1 earnings next   week. However
column26: the preliminary evidence derived from iPhone usage   data points toward a solid increase.First
column27: the iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus currently account for   about 14.5% of total iPhone usage
column28: according to Fiksu. That's exactly in line with the usage share of the iPhone 6s   and iPhone 6s Plus a year ago. Given that the iPhone user base is   probably still expanding at a double-digit annual rate
column29: an equal   usage share implies higher unit sales.Mixpanel
column30: another company that tracks iPhone usage -- but with   more U.S.-centric data -- shows an even bigger sales uptick for   the latest iPhones compared to last year's models.Second
column31: the popularity of the pricier ""Plus"" models continues   to grow
column32: even after Apple hiked its prices for the iPhone 7 Plus   lineup by $20. (Demand was so strong that the iPhone 7 Plus was   inshort supplyfor most of last quarter.) The iPhone 7 Plus had a usage share of   4.4% at the end of Q1
column33: compared to 3.4% for the iPhone 6s Plus a   year earlier.Demand for the iPhone 7 Plus has been red-hot. Image source:   Apple.Partially offsetting this
column34: the dollar has continued to rise   against some key foreign currencies (mainly the British pound and   Chinese yuan). But that just means that even a small ASP increase   would indicate significant year-over-year improvement in the   iPhone product mix.Are expectations too low?Since bottoming out around $90 in May
column35: Apple's stock price has   shot up by 34%. This suggests that investors are starting to   become more optimistic about the company's prospects.Nevertheless
column36: many Wall Street analysts still have very low   expectations. In fact
column37: analysts expect Apple to report a   year-over-year EPS decline next week
column38: despite the positive iPhone   usage data and strong growth in Apple's services business.If Apple is able to beat the estimates by reporting modest   earnings growth for Q1 and offering a solid outlook for Q2
column39: shares of the tech giant could begin 2017 with another rally.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column40: it can pay to listen. After all
column41: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column42: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column43: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Apple Earnings Strategy: When To Buy AAPL Shares;January 25
column3: 09:42:45 AM EDT;"Apple will release earnings soon (Shutterstock photo)Apple (AAPL) will release their earnings for the fourth quarter of 2017 next Tuesday
column4: and the guessing game has begun. It used to be that analysts would wait until they had seen the numbers before opining or changing any rating on Apple stock. In part that was because up until last year
column5: the company continually made those analysts look foolish by beating every quarters estimates by huge margins.That meant that investors who bought the stock in the run up to earnings invariably benefited
column6: and analysts would rush to upgrade forecasts once the extent of the beat was known. However
column7: the recent slowdown in growth has changed the dynamic somewhat.makeArticleAd();Now it seems that the competition among those that cover AAPL is to see who can come out with the gloomiest earnings prediction
column8: and who can downgrade the earliest. Over the past week two big names
column9: Barclays and Stifel have downgraded AAPL in front of earnings
column10: both citing worries about i-Phone 7 sales.This kind of focus on potential and actual negatives surrounding Apples earnings has changed the way retail investors should approach the release too. With such negativity abounding the stock is likely to lose ground as earnings approach
column11: and/or to react to anything but a spectacular report in a negative
column12: or at best muted
column13: manner.Far from buying in front of the release
column14: then
column15: waiting until afterwards makes sense this time around. That assumes that buying AAPL at all would be a good idea; an assumption not everybody will be comfortable with. The negative slant to coverage that makes it likely that you will be able to pick up AAPL cheap next week will also put off some people
column16: but a look at the facts and prospects should reassure you.First
column17: lets look at the stocks actual performance. If you listen to the naysayers they would have you believe that AAPL has underperformed recently. The reality
column18: though
column19: as demonstrated by the chart below comparing AAPL to the Nasdaq tracking ETF
column20: QQQover the last six months
column21: is completely different. During that time AAPL has outperformed its benchmark by a factor of 3
column22: gaining 24% compared to the indexs 8%.Appreciation in AAPL though
column23: as with any stock
column24: is about what will happen in the future rather than what has happened in the past
column25: but there are a few reasons to be optimistic on that front too. As I wrotea few weeks ago
column26: my personal experience suggests that demand for the Apple Watch series 2 is greater than anybody expected
column27: with a fair amount of pent up demand resulting from widespread shortages of the product in the holiday buying season.In addition
column28: even those anticipating lower than expected iPhone sales have noted that the higher priced 7 Plus has proven more popular than expected
column29: which should benefit the bottom line.All of that is positive
column30: but what investors are really looking for is for Apple to do something spectacular again in order to re-invigorate the whole ecosystem. Their recent decision to start commissioning original content for Apple TV offers the possibility of that. Content production is
column31: of course
column32: a very crowded field right now
column33: and a difficult business at the best of times
column34: but Apple has a huge advantage over others that might try to break into the market: over $200 billion in cash.As Netflix (NFLX) and Amazon (AMZN) have shown
column35: it only takes one or two hits to be successful in this area and with the ability to absorb a few failures
column36: betting against Apple succeeding would seem to be foolish.Add in a decent and growing dividend and buying or adding to holdings of AAPL is a good idea. With that said
column37: though
column38: the fact that the conventional wisdom seems to be that this will be a disappointing earnings release for the company makes patience in this case a virtue
column39: and waiting until after next Tuesdays report is a risk that should pay off."

column1: If I Could Buy Only 1 Stock
column4: 09:40:00 AM EDT;"Image source: Apple.makeArticleAd();If I could only buy one stock right now
column5: then there are a few   boxes that stock needs to check. I'd like the holding to be   relatively safe in a tumultuous time but still look likely to   generate modest short-term growth
column6: while having the potential for   exceptional long-term growth. I also want the stock to have a   robust balance sheet and be relatively cheap in this expensive   market -- and is a little dividend too much to ask?For all of that
column7: look no further thanApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) .Short-term growth prospects look goodApple's finances are massive in almost every way
column8: with sales   in the fiscal Q4 ended Sept. 24 of $47 billion. Sales and   earnings actually slowed during the during quarter
column9: down 9% and   19%
column10: respectively
column11: but the company has guided for a return to   sales growth in fiscal Q1.Some Apple bears have pointed to the company's reliance on its   iPhone -- which made up about two-thirds of sales in the most   recent quarter -- and that those sales are starting to slow as   the phone seems to be saturating the addressable market. The   average selling price (ASP) of the iPhone segment has fallen   slightly year over year.However
column12: the iPhone could have plenty of growth left. The new   iPhone 7 launched in late 2016 seems to be performing very well   already and should help to boost ASP once again. Additionally
column13: the issues with the explodingSamsungGalaxy Note 7
column14: which has even been banned on all U.S.   aircraft
column15: could help to make 2017 iPhone sales the highest   yet.Image source: Apple.The bears also point to nascent growth in most of Apple's   other products
column16: such as its personal computers
column17: iPads
column18: and the   Apple Watch. One other area that's growing impressively is the   services segment
column19: which includes revenue from services such as   iTunes
column20: iCloud
column21: and Apple Pay. This segment's revenue grew 24%   year over year to $6.3 billion in the fiscal year
column22: making up 13%   of total revenue as Apple's second largest segment by sales   behind the iPhone segment. Services are increasingly important
column23: as the total number of Apple products in use continues to grow   each quarter
column24: meaning more devices that are likely linked to an   Apple account and could help services revenue to continue growing   nicely.Apple's robust financial positionWhile Apple's sales and earnings have come under pressure
column25: its   cash growth has not. Apple's operating cash flow in the most   recent quarter surged to $16 billion
column26: a new company record for   that time period. With so much excess cash flow
column27: the company   has grown its total cash and investments to $238 billion
column28: more   than a third of its market cap
column29: and aboutdouble the next wealthiest company in the United   States.Unfortunately for Apple's capital expenditure advocates
column30: about   90% of that money is stored out of the U.S.
column31: as the company has   resisted paying heavy repatriation taxes to bring it back home.   However
column32: President Trump has signaled that he'd like to offer a   much lower tax rate
column33: maybe as low as 10%
column34: for companies in   Apple's position that are seeking to send huge chunks of money   home. There are certainly other risks for Apple in some of   Trump's proposed tax ideas
column35: such as potential import tariffs on   goods manufactured overseas
column36: but this one point is important for   what it could mean for Apple's cash available for immediate   use.Long-term growth potentialApple's new wireless headphones
column37: called ""air pods."" Image     source: Apple.Apple's modest short-term growth on continued incremental   innovations and execution is encouraging
column38: but it's much more fun   to consider Apple's moonshot long-term growth possibilities.   Apple increased its research and development spend by about 25%   to $10 billion in fiscal 2016.Speaking of the company's huge cash position
column39: there are a few   fun reckless predictions we can make about what the company might   spend that money on developing. Self-driving cars
column40: virtual   and augmented reality
column41: and more recently original content for   iTunes are all areas of growth that tech industry analysts are   looking for from Apple.My favorite reckless prediction is that Apple will begin   competing more heavily in artificial intelligence. Apple's Siri   was one of the first voice-based search tools beforeAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) andGoogle(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) entered the space with their smart   home voice-activated devices.Amazon and Google beat Apple to market with their home   assistant devices
column42: but Apple isn't known for being an early   market mover -- rather
column43: Apple has a knack for swooping in with   amazing products that in turn dominate the market that's already   there. Let's not forget that Amazon and Google have ventured into   Apple's world with their consumer electronics much more than   Apple would be venturing into theirs with its own artificial   intelligence assistant.WhyApple stockstill looks like a great buyFinally
column44: in terms of valuation
column45: Apple still looks cheap. Even   though the stock is up 20% over the past six months
column46: it's still   trading at just 14 times earnings. Compare that with around 25   times earnings on average for the S&P 500
column47: Google at 30
column48: and   Amazon at 185. Also
column49: Apple stock has run up quickly lately
column50: but   it's still down from its high of around $135 in mid-2015
column51: so its   recent run doesn't look unreasonable.Add to that a relatively cheap valuation
column52: as well as all of   the points covered here
column53: that Apple stock also pays a 2% dividend   yield
column54: which could very well rise as Apple deploys more of its   huge cash load in 2017. The best investment strategy is one   that's well diversified
column55: but for all of those points -- if I   could only buy one stock
column56: Apple continues to look like a great   stock to buy and hold as a core long-term position.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column57: it can pay to listen. After all
column58: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column59: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column60: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!   That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column62: an executive at Alphabet
column63: is a member of The     Motley Fool's board of directors.Seth McNewowns shares of Apple. The Motley Fool owns shares of and     recommends Alphabet (A shares)
column64: Alphabet (C shares)

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) iPhone Takes a Hit From  Netflix
column4: 08:39:17 AM EDT;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column5: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWhenApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) designed the iPhone and iOS mobile operating system
column6: the company chose to exclude support for external storage. On the other hand
column7: many smartphones runningAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL) Android operating system included the ability to supplement onboard storage using inexpensive SD memory cards. Not a game-changer
column8: clearly.Source: TwitterButNetflix
column9: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) just made the difference a little more important
column10: by adding support for Netflix downloads to SD cards on Android.makeArticleAd();To SD or Not to SDFrom the start
column11: AAPL spurned the idea of giving iPhone (or iPad) users access to external storage. The company designed iOS to hide file directories from the user level - keeping the user interface extremely simple - and that meant not being able to choose whether to save a file in built-in storage
column12: or in external storage.Besides keeping the user interface clean and easier to support
column13: the move also was a financial windfall for Apple. Without any option to boost storage
column14: users who wanted more than the bare minimum would be forced to pay for the next tier in iPhones. So that $649 base model became $749.AAPL's profit margin on that extra $100 was considerable
column15: since the flash memory used for storage is inexpensive.For point of comparison
column16: going from 32GB to 128GB on the iPhone 7 is an extra $100
column17: while a 128GB microSD card can be had for $50. And that's paying retail prices
column18: which AAPL most certainly does not.Google
column19: on the other hand
column20: supported the use of SD cards for external storage. It was limited at first
column21: but by Android Marshmallow
column22: Android users could use that extra storage for virtually anything
column23: including apps. They could buy cheap
column24: lower-capacity micro SD cards and swap them out at will.10 Companies That Are Bringing Jobs Back to     AmericaThis was a very popular feature
column25: asSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) discovered when it ditched the feature on the Galaxy S6. After the outcry
column26: the capabilityreturned with the Galaxy S7.Netflix Downloads Makes SD Card Support a Bigger DealThe announcement of Netflix downloads for iOS and Android was a very popular move. Watching video on a smartphone is popular
column27: but cellular data isn't cheap. The new feature meant you could watch Netflix on iPhone or Android devices while commuting
column28: traveling of just hanging around - without worrying about a big data bill.Yesterday
column29: Netflix downloads gainedSD card support on Android. Suddenly
column30: those cheap storage cards - that the iPhone cannot use - became a bigger deal. One hour of HD video downloaded to a mobile device from Netflixuses about 440MB of storage space.With movies approaching 1GB each
column31: you can see how this could add up quickly.For travelers using Netflix on iPhone
column32: the downloads could turn into an exercise in strategic file management. For someone with a Galaxy S7
column33: a $50 card they can pop in their phone would hold 100 movies or more.Netflix just may have become the killer app that makes SD cards on smartphones a serious advantage.Just Another Challenge for the iPhone 8When Apple releases the iPhone 8 in the fall
column34: it's going to be going up against intense competition. Google is expected to release the second generation of itspopularPixel Phone. More importantly
column35: Samsung appears to be throwing everything it has at the Galaxy S8. The company hasput the Galaxy Note 7 debacle behind itand is reassuring consumers the Galaxy S8 battery is practically bulletproof.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Steals AI Expert Back From     Apple Inc. (AAPL)In addition
column36: theGalaxy S8 is rumoredto have a curved
column37: bezel-free display
column38: a larger screen (in the same size form factor)
column39: iris scanner and an optional dock that turns it into an Android-running desktop PC.Netflix downloads supporting SD cards on Android smartphones won't derail the iPhone 8. However
column40: now that support for SD cards has a killer app
column41: it's one more feature - or lack thereof - the competition can hammer on when AAPL releases its all-important 10th anniversary iPhone.As of this writing
column42: Brad Moon did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. New iPads Might Be Late to the Party     (AAPL)3 Things Apple Inc. (AAPL) MUST Do to Soar in     2017Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Steps on Amazon     and Google's TurfThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) iPhone Takes a Hit From  Netflix

column1: The Tech Battle for the Classroom Is Heating Up;January 24
column3: 09:39:00 PM EDT;"Image source: Getty Images.Alphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) has been making steady gains in   the classroom
column4: thanks to the Chromebook. The search giant is   looking to maintain that momentum and has just announced two new   Chromebooks that are specifically designed for the educational   market. Google is also taking the opportunity to share a few data   points. There are now 20 million teachers and students using   Chromebooks and Google Classroom
column5: and over 70 million people now   use G Suite for Education
column6: the company's online productivity   suite that's tailored for educational purposes.makeArticleAd();A tale of two new educational ChromebooksThe two new devices are the Acer Chromebook Spin 11 and the   ASUS Chromebook C213. Google says it collaborated with educators   to include features that would specifically help in the   classroom. Specifically
column7: that includes stylus support for   students to draw and take notes. In order to keep costs down
column8: the   styluses are cheap
column9: don't need to be charged or paired
column10: and are   easily replaced if lost. This move is clearly designed to broaden   appeal by offering something that tablets do.In May 2016
column11: Google said it was bringing Android apps to   Chrome OS. This was part of Google's broader strategy to merge   Chrome OS and Android. Administrators will be able to install   Android apps on educational Chromebooks
column12: which is a big win   considering how much more educational content is available for   Android.Microsoft wants inChromebooks and tablets have largely displaced low-costMicrosoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) PCs
column13: but the software giant is fighting back.   Microsoft also just announced Intune for Education. Intune is the   company's mobile device management offering
column14: which has   historically been catered to the enterprise. Intune for Education   will be a cloud-based application for device management
column15: which   will allow administrators to manage a group of Windows 10 devices   in educational settings. Microsoft says this is one of two   critical pieces that it has been missing in the educational   market
column16: with the other being affordable Windows 10 PCs.Video source: Microsoft.Microsoft makes it clear that it's taking a direct shot at   Chromebooks
column17: saying
column18: ""New Windows 10 Devices Offer Great   Alternatives to Chromebooks."" The company is unveiling a slew of   new Windows 10 devices that are targeting education
column19: fromHP
column20: Acer
column21: and Lenovo.Where's Apple?A few years back
column22: Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) tried to position the iPad as the ideal   educational computing device
column23: but for the most part those   aspirations have fallen flat. Chromebooks are able to undercut   iPads by a significant margin
column24: and the presence of an attached   keyboard is important for education and productivity. Many of the   Chromebooks and Windows PCs that are gaining traction in the   educational market are priced at just $150 to $300; the cheapest   iPad is the aging iPad Mini 2 that was launched in 2013 and   currently costs $269.The educational market has long been important to Apple from a   philosophical perspective
column25: if not a financial one. But prices   continue to fall
column26: hindering Apple's ability to compete.   Importantly
column27: 2-in-1 devices are expected to continue growing in   education
column28: and Apple does not offer a full-fledged 2-in-1   product.It looks like Microsoft and Google may end up winning the   battle for the classroom.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: The Problem With Apple's TV Ambitions;January 24
column3: 07:49:00 PM EDT;"Image Source: Motley Fool.Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) has toyed with the idea of entering the television   industry for what seems like ages now. Since it unveiled the   original Apple TV in 2007
column4: the company has considered   manufacturing its own television set
column5: putting together a ""skinny   bundle
column6: and even
column7: according to pundits
column8: making an offer for a   company likeNetflix(NASDAQ: NFLX) .makeArticleAd();Apple has long had a foothold in music ever since it launched   iTunes
column9: and television could bring the same complementary   benefits to its ecosystem. Apple already sells many of the   devices used to consume streaming video
column10: and technology has   tipped the entertainment scales toward tech companies rather than   traditional media players. After Netflix
column11: e-commerce giantAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) has made the biggest splash in streaming.Now Apple wants to join the herd
column12: producing its own original   shows. According toTheWall Street Journal
column13: the company has been in talks with producers to make its own   programming
column14: which would be available to subscribers of its   $10/month music-streaming service. The company hopes to launch   such programming by the end of 2017.However
column15: while it seems natural for Apple to have ambitions in   TV
column16: diving straight into original programming could present a   number of challenges for the company.1. Profits are thinAfter years of breakneck international expansion
column17: Netflix is   finally set to deliver its first year of ""material profits"" since   2011
column18: when it split its streaming service from its DVD-by-mail   business after years of operating at breakeven. Amazon
column19: meanwhile
column20: doesn't break out figures for its streaming service
column21: and essentially gives it away to its Prime members
column22: using its   content as a carrot to entice more people to shop on its   website.The point is that video streaming is no one's idea of a cash   cow at this point. The services are so cheap
column23: at about $10/month
column24: that a company needs to generate a substantial base before hoping   to make a profit. Netflix
column25: for example
column26: is set to top 100 million   subscribers this year
column27: but it took the company years to get to   that point. Apple could operate the service at a loss
column28: but that   seems contrary to the company's high-margin business model. With   more than $45 billion in net income in its last fiscal year
column29: it's   going to take more than a small video streaming service to move   the needle.2. Where's the expertise?Apple is a device-maker. Its brand and its profits come from   making hardware like the iPhone
column30: iPad
column31: and the Mac. Developing   and shopping for TV shows is outside of its core competencies
column32: and because iTunes has languished over the years
column33: it lacks the   detailed data that competitors like Netflix have on customer   preferences.Analysts dismissed Netflix's initial ambitions in original   programming
column34: but the company's vast database guided it when it   chose to remake the British seriesHouse of Cards
column35: as it recognized that its subscribers had a penchant for   political dramas and actor Kevin Spacey. That show would be the   first of several hit series for Netflix.Amazon may have had to start more from scratch
column36: though it had   its own a la carte streaming service before getting into   originals. That company's culture also prizes innovation
column37: risk-taking
column38: and failure
column39: and it launched its original   programming in 2013
column40: giving it a significant head start over   Apple. Thanks to its Prime subscriber base
column41: the company quickly   found an audience for its shows. In comparison
column42: Apple under Tim   Cook seems more content to leverage its current assets and   products into new revenue streams rather than build fresh   ones.If Apple wishes to give away original programming to its Apple   Music subscribers
column43: it may be able to build viewership like Amazon   did. But Apple doesn't have the same interest in adding perks to   Apple Music the way Amazon does with Prime. Ultimately
column44: the   company needs to find a way to grow profits
column45: and original TV   seems unlikely to do that either directly or indirectly as its   impact on hardware sales would probably be limited.Apple's track record in television so far also bodes poorly   for its ambitions
column46: as the company seems unclear of its ultimate   goal and is unable to successfully negotiate with media partners.   With its hardware sales stalling
column47: Apple has increasingly turned   to services like Apple Music or Apple Pay
column48: but the relationship   between its devices and TV seems tenuous at best. Rather than   entering the increasingly competitive media environment
column49: the   company would be better off leading with its strength
column50: directly   investing in research and development that would advance hardware   sales or develop its next blockbuster product..10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Bad News for Apple: Plenty of People Think the iPhone 6s Is Good Enough;January 24
column3: 06:48:00 PM EDT;"The iPhone 7 didn't have a killer feature (no headphone jack   doesn't count). Image source: Apple.It goes without saying thatApple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) singular goal with every year's iPhone upgrade   cycle is to provide just enough new features to coax legions of   its loyal fans into upgrading to the latest and greatest model --   ideally every single year. It's also clear that this has proven   increasingly difficult
column4: as smartphones these days are so good   that it's hard to imagine the company releasing groundbreaking or   revolutionary features anymore.makeArticleAd();Unfortunately
column5: that may also be true of the most recent iPhone   7. Even personally
column6: 2016 was thefirst time in eight yearsthat I didn't upgrade to the newest model.Word on the StreetBarclaysanalyst Mark Moskowitz has just put out a research note (viaTech Trader Daily)
column7: downgrading shares from overweight to equal weight
column8: which is   the equivalent of dropping his rating from buy to hold. The   analyst also reduced his price target by $2 to $117
column9: which is   notably slightly below current prices.Investors have seen plenty of signs that the smartphone market   has been weakening for a year or two
column10: a trend that's not letting   up anytime soon. Moskowitz's research suggests that many   smartphone customers are increasingly picking 2015's iPhone 6s   instead of 2016's iPhone 7
column11: the former of which costs $100 less.   Lacking any killer
column12: must-have features
column13: the new model simply   doesn't justify the $100 premium in many consumers' minds.That's largely why Moskowitz has reduced his average selling   price (ASP) estimate from $650 to $648. That $2 difference may   not sound like a lot
column14: but keep in mind we're talking about   roughly 220 million iPhone units that the analyst expects the   company to sell in 2017. A $2 difference in ASP translates into   $440 million less in revenue. For reference
column15: Apple sold 211.9   million iPhones last fiscal year (which ended in September)
column16: generating $136.7 billion in revenue
column17: which translates into an   ASP of $645.Smartphones are also seeing upgrade cycles elongate
column18: as the   product category matures and people are keeping their phones for   longer and longer. Currently
column19: most consumers keep their phones   from two to three years on average
column20: but this could stretch to   three to four years
column21: in Moskowitz's view. This same thing   happened remarkably fast in tablets
column22: which is partially why the   iPad hit a speed bump a few years back that it has yet to recover   from
column23: but now it's happening in Apple's most important   business.Will 8 be great?Whether or not Apple has some game-changing innovation up its   sleeve for the iPhone 8 remains to be seen
column24: but judging from the   leaks we've seen thus far
column25: the presumed ""iPhone 8"" is unlikely to   have some type of revolutionary feature. Things like an OLED   display
column26: wireless charging
column27: or edge-to-edge display are welcome   improvements
column28: but may not be able to spur the ""super cycle"" that many analysts are expecting.Shareholders (myself included) should set their 2017   expectations to ""meh.""10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: The Top 5 Brands Millennials Love to Love;January 24
column3: 05:08:00 PM EDT;"Market research firmMBLMhas released its latest Brand Intimacy Report
column4: which measures the   emotional attachment consumers have to various brands. The study   reveals that a strong connection is a key ingredient to a better   relationship with customers. This translates to better results   for the company over the long term
column5: and likely will have a   positive effect on its stock price.There's additional evidence that these customers are willing   to pay a premium for those preferred brands. Let's look at the   brands that have the strongest attachments for millennials and   why.makeArticleAd();Total Return Pricedata byYCharts.Nintendo enjoys a resurgence. Image source:Pixabay.5. Nintendo(NASDAQOTH: NTDOY) . Having grown up with Nintendo
column6: millennials   have an emotional attachment to the company and its games. The   first of the millennials were just old enough to begin playingSuper Mario Brotherswhen it launched in late 1985
column7: and continued with fan favorites   likeZelda
column8: Final Fantasy
column9: Tetris
column10: andPokemon. Nintendo acknowledged those ties last year in a Father's Day   press release
column11: saying
column12: ""For dads today
column13: especially the   millennials
column14: Nintendo was a big part of their childhood.""Not content to rest on its laurels
column15: the company is enjoying a   resurgence with the popularity ofPokemon Go
column16: its mobile augmented-reality game
column17: which sends users on a   virtual scavenger hunt for its characters. In its most recent   quarter
column18: Nintendo reported hardware sales that rose 19% over the   previous year
column19: and reports indicate that the release of the   next-generation game is imminent.Millennials just want their technology to work. Image     source: Author.4. Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) . Most millennials would have just been entering   their earning years with the release of the iPhone in 2007. The   introduction of the iPod six years earlier and it's 80% market   share provided a perfect transition.Research shows that
column20: as a group
column21: millennials are the most   dependent on their phones. Over 78% of millennials use their   phones more than two hours per day
column22: 80% reach for their phones   first thing
column23: and 87% report that their phones never leave their   sides.Millennials have grown up with technology and expect it to   work
column24: so dependability is important to them.Reader's Digestcalled iPhones the most trusted mobile phone brand for 2016. That   level of familiarity
column25: coupled with reliability
column26: breeds a certain   attachment.Netflix and chill. Image source: Netflix.3. Netflix(NASDAQ: NFLX) . Netflix is becoming the new normal
column27: and nowhere   is that more apparent than among millennials. As a group
column28: this   demographic was born in the information age and is more tech   savvy than previous generations
column29: so streaming Netflix is a   natural.In the decade since Netflix began streaming
column30: it has been   embraced by the generation that now outnumbers baby boomers.   MBLM's Managing Partner Mario Natarelli said
column31: ""We found that   escapist brands performed especially well -- mostly in the media   and entertainment industry -- due to...the need for distraction
column32: control and enjoyment."" Netflix and chill
column33: baby. Netflix and   chill.Placing web orders is a cinch. Image source: Amazon.2. Amazon(NASDAQ: AMZN) . Millennials grew up watching their parents order   items in the little smiley boxes
column34: and now embrace it themselves.   Placing orders from a website
column35: or on a mobile app
column36: is a cinch for   this tech-comfortable bunch. Previous studies have shown   millennials view Amazon as their most relevant brand
column37: as   well. It applies as an escapist play in the same manner as   Netflix
column38: via its Prime streaming service.Millennials' social networking proclivities play a part
column39: as   they share their product opinions
column40: and solicit the views of   others. This plays directly to Amazon's DNA of customer reviews.   As consumers
column41: millennials also collaborate with the brands they   connect with
column42: and according to studies
column43: they believe that   Amazon has the best customer service.The Happiest Place on Earth! Image source: Author.1. Disney(NYSE: DIS) . As much as any other company on the list
column44: Disney   taps into the nostalgia of millennials
column45: while remaining a part of   their present. From the young stars on the Disney channel to some   of millenials' comic book favorites coming to life on the big   screen
column46: Disney has always been there.According to Mario Natarelli
column47: MBLM's managing partner
column48: ""Disney   resonates with this age group because they grew up with the   brand. It has kept up with their changing interests and now   includes popular franchises likeStar Warsand Marvel... Disney is also a mainstay for young families.""Millennials
column49: as a group
column50: feel strongly about their values
column51: as   well as the companies they interact with. Walt Disney was known   for his strong sense of family values
column52: and that affinity toward   his customers still permeates the company he founded.Each of these companies has succeeded at creating an emotional   connection with its customers
column53: in general
column54: and the millennial   generation
column55: in particular. This research shows that strong   positive feelings from consumers can be one factor supporting   strong company results and better stock performance. This   provides investors with another criteria for choosing a winning   investment.Can you feel the love?10 stocks we like better than Walt DisneyWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column56: it can pay to listen. After all
column57: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column58: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column59: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now and Walt Disney wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Is Customer Satisfaction the Hidden Key to Stock Outperformance?;January 24
column4: we have all been frustrated by companies which did not meet our expectations. Either poor service or a low quality product
column5: the end result was always the desire to do less business with the given company.However
column6: on the other side of the coin
column7: there are those companies out there that go above and beyond
column8: time and time again. Those are the companies I like to frequent
column9: and I have always wondered if these types of firms-which have a long history of satisfying their customers-end up making better investments too.Well
column10: in this edition ofthe Dutram Report
column11: I talk to Kevin Quigg
column12: chief strategist of ACSI Funds
column13: for some insights into this topic and if this idea works as an investment.Inside ACSIKevin is an expert in the American Customer Satisfaction Index
column14: a benchmark that exists to find companies that customers either like
column15: or would rather avoid. This is done by looking at a few key areas of the customer satisfaction process
column16: including customer expectations
column17: perceived value
column18: and perceived quality.This data has proven to be extremely popular with companies
column19: as it helps them to keep tabs on the competition and to see their relative standing among their peers too. But the data can also be used to shape the outlook for companies and to see how they are trending in terms of customer satisfaction
column20: which can help to show which companies are moving in the right direction.ACSI's idea is that customer satisfaction leads to customer loyalty
column21: which leads to additional consumer spending which ultimately leads to long-term stock appreciation. This intuitively makes sense
column22: and now there is a way to use this strategy in ETF form.The ETFThis is via ACSI Funds' American Customer Satisfaction Core Alpha ETF (ACSI). This product holds securities that have high ACSI customer satisfaction scores
column23: with the theory being that these will outperform their low-satisfaction peers.Current holdings include well-respected names like Apple (AAPL)
column24: Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) and Alphabet (GOOG) just to name a few
column25: though there are dozens of names in the portfolio. And if you are wondering what is done for sectors where customer satisfaction levels aren't as readily available
column26: such as energy or materials
column27: big ETFs-such as XLE or XLB-are utilized in order to give more market-like exposure.Bottom LineFor a more in-depth look at this index as well as its investable counterpart
column28: make sure to listen to the podcast for additional information. We highlight some of the strengths and potential pitfalls when it comes to this strategy
column29: and how it might fit into a portfolio too.So
column30: make sure to listen to this edition ofthe Dutram Reportfor a closer look at this novel segment of the equity world for some one-of-a-kind insights into this market
column31: and the potential for investors to exploit this simple idea for their portfolios. And for more news and discussion regarding the world of ETFs
column32: make sure to be on the lookout for the next edition ofthe Dutram Report
column33: and check out themany other great Zacks podcasts as well!Want key ETF info delivered straight to your   inbox?Zacks' free Fund Newsletter will brief you on top news and analysis
column34: as well as top-performing ETFs
column35: each week.Get it free >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today

column1: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) Q4 Earnings Preview: Pixel & Home Could Fuel Growth;January 24
column4: all eyes will be on the company formerly known as Google
column5: Alphabet Inc.GOOGL
column6: as the tech giant prepares to release its fourth-quarter earnings report on Thursday. The company rolled out its new Google Pixel phone and ushered in a new era of hardware-software interaction during the quarter
column7: making this week's announcement even more important than usual.In fact
column8: the Google Pixel will most likely be the most compelling aspect of Alphabet's latest report
column9: and investors will be clamoring to know how the device sold. It will also be interesting to see what the company says about its Google Home Controller
column10: which also launched in the U.S. this quarter.The Google Pixel is important because it is Alphabet's first high-end smartphone entirely produced in-house and represents a significant challenge to Apple'sAAPLiPhone line. The Google Home tells another story of competition; the ""Internet of Things"" in-home hub is one of the only competitors to Amazon'sAMZNEcho speaker.More importantly
column11: both of these products underscore Alphabet's efforts to usher in its intelligent personal assistant software
column12: Google Assistant. With similar functions to Apple's Siri and Microsoft'sMSFTCortana
column13: Google Assistant is the backbone of the Pixel and Home devices and promises to be the foundation for all of Google's original products heading forward.Also
column14: investors should not forget about the other products that Google launched in the quarter
column15: all of which were officially unveiled at the same event in October. The company debuted its stylish headset for the Daydream VR platform
column16: the ""Daydream View
column17: as well as its first router
column18: ""Google Wifi
column19: and a Chromecast update
column20: ""Chromecast Ultra.""All of these products are important pieces of Google's effort to create a complete line of products that work together and with the new Google Assistant software. This is just the first quarter of sales
column21: but it is also the holiday quarter and should give us a good idea of whether or not these products are resonating with shoppers.Heading into the report
column22: Alphabet Inc. has seen one positive estimate revision over the past week. Our current consensus estimates indicate EPS growth of 8.40% and sales growth of 18.75%
column23: and this has helped earn the company an ""A"" grade for growth. This is especially noteworthy given the relative size and status of Alphabet already. Overall
column24: the stock has a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy)
column25: and that's always a good sign heading into an earnings announcement.Nevertheless
column26: Alphabet currently has an Earnings ESP of -0.26%
column27: which makes surprise prediction a bit more difficult.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column28: would you like to know about our 10 finest tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? These 10 are painstakingly hand-picked from 4
column29: 400 companies covered by the Zacks Rank. They are our primary picks to buy and hold.Be among the very first to see them >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today
column30: you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days.Click to get this free reportmakeArticleAd();Amazon.com

column1: Why 2017 Will Be the Year of the Virtual Assistant;January 24
column3: 03:32:00 PM EDT;"In its annual mobile apps survey
column4: Research firm Gartner   predicted that by 2019 virtual assistants will account for20% of all smartphone interactions. With that level of user engagement
column5: predictably all of   the largest technology companies are invested in the segment and   each brings a different strength to the field.Will 2017 be the year of the virtual assistant?  Image   source: Pixabay.makeArticleAd();Amazon Echo powered by Alexa. Image source: Amazon.com.AmazonMany media reports  are callingAmazon's(NASDAQ: AMZN) Alexa the hit of the Consumer Electronics Show.    In 2015
column6: Amazon made a skills kit available to developers   that allowed partners to incorporate voice commands. Fast forward   to 2017 and Alexa can integrate with an estimated 5
column7: 000   third-party apps
column8: from refrigerators to TV's
column9: from cars to   vacuums
column10: and lest we forget
column11: the Echo smart home speaker.    The novelty of this device made it among the top selling   items on Amazon's website during the holidays. This was a   brilliant strategic move by a company without a smartphone as an   installed base. Amazon does
column12: however
column13: have a roster of well-known   companies in its corner including Ford
column14: Samsung and LG to name a   few. In addition to product integration
column15: Alexa can be found in a   dizzying number of bots that can order a pizza from Domino's
column16: schedule an Uber
column17: or check your Capital One balance. This gives   Amazon the early lead in terms of reach and momentum
column18: but the   lack of a mobile device means that challenges remain.Apple's Siri. Image source: Apple.AppleApple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column19: represented in the category by Siri
column20: hasn't seen   much love. Her earliest incarnation could only answer correctly   about 65% of the time
column21: and users complained that far too   often she defaulted to Google rather than answering the question.   Consumers tend to remember those early first experiences
column22: and   Siri still has a bad reputation. She shouldn't be counted out   yet
column23: though. Apple has been taking steps to improve Siri's   understanding. In mid-2014
column24: Siri's brain was replaced by an   artificial intelligence (AI) based neural network and Apple   claims that Siri now has a less than 5% error rate. Apple argues   that it isn't necessary to upload all of your data to the cloud   in order for Siri to improve. It uses a technique called   differential privacy
column25: which keeps individual information at the   local phone level and protects user privacy.  Though it   currently doesn't have a
column26: Echo-like voice-activated speaker
column27: reports indicatethat a prototype is currently in the testing stage.Google Home powered by Google Assistant. Image source:     Google.AlphabetAlphabet's(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google has introduced Google   Assistant
column28: which expands on the capabilities of Google Now and OK   Google. This assistant is currently available on its Pixel phones   and can be accessed on other smartphones via the Google Allo app.   This virtual helper is more conversational and has produced   impressive early results due to experiences gained from its   predecessors. It was found to rival and in many cases surpass its   nearest competitors. Assistant's greatest strength may be the   ability to answer follow-up questions
column29: a feature many of its   rivals lack. Integration with Google Home smart speaker puts it   squarely in competition with Amazon's Echo. Its strengths include   entire home synchronized audio and grouping of smart-home   commands.Some researchersbelieve that Alexa will cede its early lead in the category to   Google Assistant by 2020.Microsoft Cortana. Image source: Microsoft.MicrosoftMicrosoft's(NASDAQ: MSFT) Cortana is available across its Windows 10-based   devices including phones
column30: tablets and PC's. It has many competing   features
column31: but has exhibited difficulties responding to requests
column32: reminiscent of Siri's early days. Microsoft announced late last   year that it would open Cortana to third party integration
column33: so   expect a number of hardware integrations on the horizon. It has   yet to introduce an interactive speaker
column34: but its first hardware   partner is Harman Kardon and one is expected sometime this year.    In a shrewd move
column35: the kit used by developers is remarkably   similar to that of Alexa
column36: allowing them to piggyback off the work   they have already done. This will accelerate the process of   producing hardware that will integrate Cortana.Near-ubiquitous technologyThose interested in a task-based comparison between the four   might findthis articlebyBusiness Insiderof interest. Despite the varying capabilities among these   entries
column37: one thing is clear: nearly every person with a computer
column38: tablet
column39: smartphone
column40: or home speaker system will have access to a   virtual personal assistant in the coming year. With this level of   exposure
column41: consumers will begin to adopt these virtual assistants
column42: and as the technology becomes more advanced
column43: providers will find   new
column44: more innovative ways to incorporate them into our everyday   lives. Society is still in the early stages of the adoption cycle   for these digital helpers
column45: but it appears that this year is the   tipping point.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock       tip
column46: it can pay to listen. After all
column47: the newsletter they       have run for over a decade
column48: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column49: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of       them! column1: Tuesday Apple Rumors: Siri May Get a Major Upgrade in iOS 11;January 24
column4: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is news of improvements to Siri. Today
column5: we'll   look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor Tuesday.Siri Upgrade:A new report claims that Siri will be getting an   upgrade when the 2017 iPhone comes out
column6: AppleInsidernotes. According to this report
column7: the upgrade for Siri will   enhance the virtual assistant so that it can better compete   against others. The report claims that this update to Siri will   be released with the launch of iOS 11
column8: which will likely show up   at the Worldwide Developers Conference this year. As it is   now
column9: Siri can't quite keep up with virtual assistants fromAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column10: GOOGL) andAmazon.com
column11: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).makeArticleAd();Find My AirPods:The new iOS 10.3 beta includes a feature to help   users find their missing AirPods
column12: reportsMacRumors. This new feature is called ""Find My AirPods"" and it is designed   to help owners of the wireless headphones keep track of them. The   new beta also includes updates for HomeKit
column13: CarPlay and more. It   is available to developers registered with Apple. The beta comes   out just one day after the tech company released the final   version of iOS 10.2.1.macOS Sierra 10.12.4:The first beta for macOS Sierra 10.12.4 is   now available to developers
column14: 9to5Macnotes. The beta for macOS Sierra 10.12.4 includes several   new features. The biggest one is the addition of a Night Shift   feature. This lets users set their devices to slowly shift colors   as the time changes. The feature has already been present on   Apple's mobile devices for about one year. The beta also includes   an update for Siri so users can ask about cricket   scores. PDFKit APIs also got an update to improve the   display of PDFs in apps with framework.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postTuesday Apple Rumors: Siri May Get a Major   Upgrade in iOS 11appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Reviewing Samsung's Q4 2016 Figures And What Lies Ahead;January 24
column3: 02:06:56 PM EDT;"Samsung Electronics (SSNLF) published its Q4 2016 results on Tuesday
column4: posting its highest operating profit in over three years
column5: as a strong market for semiconductor products and the depreciation of the Korean Won helped the company overcome some setbacks faced by its smartphone division
column6: following the discontinuation of its fire-prone Note 7 smartphones in Q3. While overall revenues remained almost flat at53.33 trillion won ($45.8 billion)
column7: operating profits expanded by about 50% to 9.22 trillion won ($7.9 billion). Samsung expects earnings to improve in 2017
column8: as the company takes advantage of strong semiconductor pricing and stable demand
column9: although the smartphone unit could face some challenges
column10: amid higher marketing costs
column11: slowing global smartphone shipment growth and mounting competition. Below we take a look at some of the key factors that drove Samsung's performance over the last quarter and what to expect in 2017.We have a$1
column12: 340 price estimate for Samsung Electronics
column13: which is slightly ahead of the current market price.See our complete analysis for SamsungmakeArticleAd();SemiconductorUnit Outperforms On Tight Supply And Samsung's High-End FocusSamsung's semiconductor business had a solid quarter
column14: with revenues rising by 12.5% to 14.86 trillion won ($12.74 billion)
column15: and operating profits growing by about 77% to a record 4.95 trillion won ($4.24 billion)
column16: driven largely by the memory business. Supply-demand conditions in the memory market have been tight
column17: with mobile OEMs increasing memory content on devices
column18: effectively bolstering demand for NAND modules
column19: while PC DRAM is seeing some under-supply
column20: as major vendors have been reducing their production mix in favor of mobile DRAM
column21: boosting prices. While Samsung has been benefiting from the broader market tailwinds
column22: the company's technology edge and its focus on higher value products also appear to be paying off.For instance
column23: Samsung is focusing on high density/performance DRAM over commodity DRAM
column24: while expanding process migration to the 48-layer 3D V-NAND. Samsung is looking improve its process technologies further in 2017
column25: migrating to to 1x-nm DRAM and 64-layer V-NAND
column26: driving down costs. The company's system LSI business
column27: which manufactures processors
column28: also aided Q4 earnings
column29: driven by strong demand for mid-to-low end app processors. 2017 is expected to be an important year for the LSI division
column30: as Samsung looks to ramp-up production of the next generation 10-nm products from its foundry operations. These chips
column31: which could be a fixture of high-end smartphones in 2017
column32: are touted to be more battery efficient
column33: while offering better performance and a smaller form factor.Smartphone Business Largely Shrugs Off Note 7 ImpactSamsung's smartphone division fared reasonably well
column34: despite the Note 7 recall which occurred in late Q3. Although segment revenues declined by about 5.5% year-over-year to 23.61 trillion won ($20.27 billion)
column35: operating profits rose by about 12% to 2.5 trillion won ($2.15 billion). Profitability for the quarter was aided by strong sales of the company's flagship Galaxy S7 and S7 Edge
column36: which have higher margins
column37: as well as sales of its mid-range smartphones such as the A and J series. That said
column38: things are likely to remain subdued over Q1 2017
column39: as Samsung is increasing its marketing spending in order to rebuild its brand following the Note 7 crisis.  Moreover
column40: the company's upcoming Galaxy S8 flagship is likely to launch in Q2
column41: moving away from the March launch cycle that the company adopted with the S7. The upcoming device will be crucial to Samsung
column42: as the company looks to restore its image as a vendor of cutting-edge smartphones
column43: while contending with increasing competition in the high-end of the smartphone market as Apple preps to launch a completely redesigned iPhone later this year
column44: while Google ramps up sales and distribution of its critically acclaimed Pixel devices. (related: Will The Galaxy S8 Deliver For Samsung Shareholders?)View Interactive Institutional Research (Powered by Trefis):Global Large Cap | U.S. Mid & Small Cap | European Large & Mid CapMore Trefis Research"

column1: CVX Stock: How to Trade Chevron Corporation Q4 Earnings;January 24
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEnergy giant andDow Jones Industrial AverageconstituentChevron Corporation(NYSE:CVX) reports earnings Friday morning. In the days leading up to the event
column5: traders and investors alike are both asking themselves whether Chevron will trump fourth-quarter earnings expectations
column6: or whether the corporate confessional will cause a spill in CVX stock.Source:swong95765 via Flickr (Modified)Let's take a look at recent announcements for Chevron
column7: analyze the CVX stock chart and determine what (if anything) the options market is suggesting will come Friday.makeArticleAd();Then
column8: we'll set up a trade to help you capture profits from the announcement.Chevron Earnings Picture and Analyst   SentimentAhead of Chevron's Friday morning Q4 earnings release
column9: analysts are forecasting profits of 66 cents per share. Actual estimates encompass a very wide range from 35 cents to $1.15.The mean Street expectation implies a whopping 154% earnings growth year-over-year
column10: as Chevron reported a mere 26 cents in profit in 2016. That result came up short of views by more than 50%. We're not holding our breath
column11: but if Wall Street is on the money this time
column12: the 66-cent profit would represent a sequential decline of 8.3% from Q3
column13: which surprised by 31.5% to the upside.Revenues are estimated to grow by 26% to $36.7 billion compared to 2015's sales of $29.2 billion. Here too
column14: range views are volatile
column15: with a low forecast of $27.2 billion compared to a Street high of $62 billion. Sequentially
column16: CVX's revenues are forecast to jump by 22%.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy""     2017The Wall Street community is split on Chevron stock. Eighteen rate the stock a buy
column17: while 10 maintain hold ratings. Price targets on CVX range from a low of $95 to $145 with a median estimate of $125.50 over the year.CVX Stock Short-Term Trading RecordIf it isn't obvious yet
column18: Chevron has established a mixed record compared to actual Street profit views. Over the past couple years
column19: CVX has beaten forecasts 58% of the time
column20: while missing 42%.Investor reaction has proven a bit more consistent
column21: with gains in four of the past six announcements immediately following earnings.Working backwards
column22: CVX stock has moved 3.91%
column26: 1.10% and -4.89% on a close-to-close basis. The net reaction in Chevron has produced an average gain of 0.2% in the first full session of trading. Variability of 2.86% based on a one standard deviation reading yields an estimated range of -2.66% to 3.06%.In other words
column27: Chevron doesn't often move that much.CVX's seven-day performance has also allowed for a fairly benign average result
column28: with shares falling marginally by 0.23%. However
column29: the longer period has been accompanied by a much larger standard deviation of 5.14% and bumpier forecast range of -5.37% to 4.91%.CVX Stock Weekly ChartClick to EnlargeShares of Chevron are in an uptrend and providing a nice
column30: lower-risk pullback entry point. The provided weekly view shows a corrective move of nearly 49% followed by a bullish uptrend
column31: which began back in late 2014.Currently
column32: CVX stock is in the process of establishing a minor counter-move of several weeks. The overall shape of the pattern resembles a bullish weekly cup-and-handle.With the handle or pullback situated above the 62% retracement level and longer-term weekly moving averages
column33: bullish traders are provided plenty of technical support. That said
column34: these supports comprise a fairly wide price range in CVX stock.Testing of the penetrated 50% level and 50-week simple moving average near $102.50-$104 is roughly 10% to 11% below the current share price in CVX. Such a price drop wouldn't invalidate the uptrend
column35: but the allowance for the current handle would certainly be compromised.How to Trade CVX StockThe spread between implied and underlying volatility in CVX has widened over the past month. Not only is 30-day implied volatility mostly flat
column36: but it continues to trade in a very narrow price band - from about 15% to just above 20% over the past few months.At the same time
column37: statistical volatility of CVX stock has fallen to around 12% and fresh two-year lows.Sell GoPro Inc Stock on This Pointless Karma     Rally (GPRO)The at-the-money 27 Jan $116 straddle market points to a 68% chance BAC will remain within an approximate price range of $113.40 to $118.60 into Friday's expiration. The math behind the calculated range is based on implied volatility of 25%
column38: three trading sessions and shares of Chevron at $116.The purest play on the earnings event is the weekly contract. Even during quiet periods like the one CVX stock is witnessing now
column39: those premiums reflect what traders collectively expect to happen in the stock in the immediate aftermath of earnings.The dollar move up or down works out to wiggle room of about 2.26% by Friday's close - a fairly quiet and typical event.Investment accounts under Christopher Tyler's management do   not currently own positions in any of the securities or their   derivatives mentioned in this article. column1: Nokia Complaint vs Apple Forms Basis of USITC Investigation of Smartphones
column4: 12:03:40 PM EDT;"Nokia's (NOK) complaint filed against Apple (AAPL)
column5: alleging violations of the Tariff Act of 1930 has become the basis of a new investigation by the U.S. International Trade Commission into certain electronic devices
column6: including mobile phones
column7: tablet computers
column8: and components thereof.The commission said the investigation is based on the complaint related to the importation into the US and sale of certain electronic devices
column9: including mobile phones
column10: tablet computers
column11: and components thereof that allegedly infringe patents asserted by Nokia. It said Nokia has requested that the USITC issue a limited exclusion order and a cease and desist order.""By instituting this investigation...the USITC has not yet made any decision on the merits of the case
column12: the commission said. ""The USITC's chief administrative law judge will assign the case to one of the USITC's administrative law judges
column13: who will schedule and hold an evidentiary hearing. The ALJ will make an initial determination as to whether there is a violation of section 337; that initial determination is subject to review by the Commission.""makeArticleAd();It noted that it will make a final determination at the earliest practicable time
column14: noting that within 45 days after institution of the investigation
column15: the USITC will set a target date for completing the investigation."
